0.title: I'm impressed with Ayushmann's work, he picks up beautiful projects: Gajraj
0.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao said in an interview that he takes inspiration from Ayushmann Khurrana's "creative journey". "I'm very impressed with the work Ayushmann has been doing...It is interesting how he so bravely picks up such beautiful projects, such different projects," he added. Gajraj and Ayushmann shared screen space in 'Badhaai Ho' and 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'.

1.title: RSS, BJP attacking Birsa Munda's ideology: Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra
1.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said tribal leader Birsa Munda's ideology is being attacked by the RSS and BJP. Attending a Tribal Convention during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra's Hingoli, Rahul said, "They (BJP) have deep strategy behind changing the name of tribal people from 'Adivasi' to 'Vanvasi', and with this, they have seized many rights of them."

2.title: Sale of Pak-made Rooh Afza permanently banned on Amazon India by Delhi HC
2.article_body: The Delhi High Court has permanently restrained the sale of identical products under the 'Rooh Afza' trademark on Amazon India. This came after the Indian sherbet's maker Hamdard National Foundation filed a case against the e-commerce website and some sellers who were offering products of its Pakistani counterpart. The court earlier told Amazon India to remove Pakistan-made Rooh Afza's listings.

3.title: Haven't got invitation for Rahul Gandhi's Shegaon rally: Ajit Pawar
3.article_body: NCP MLA Ajit Pawar on Tuesday said Congress hasn't invited him for attending Rahul Gandhi's rally in Maharashtra's Shegaon. Senior NCP leaders might attend the rally if they are invited, he added. Earlier, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh announced that a grand public meeting would be held in Shegaon on Friday. NCP and Congress are part of Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance.

4.title: Female-led 'Pirates of...' film shelved by Disney, says Margot Robbie
4.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie has said the female-led 'Pirates of the Caribbean' has been shelved by Disney. The Australian actress stated, "We had an idea...we were developing it for a while, ages ago, to have more of a female-led...a different kind of story, which we thought would've been really cool." "But I guess, they don't want to do it," she concluded.

5.title: India ray of hope for world in 21st century: PM Modi in Indonesia
5.article_body: While addressing the Indian community in Indonesia's Bali, PM Narendra Modi said that India is a ray of hope for the world in the 21st century. "Today's India doesn't think small. Today India is doing work at unprecedented scale and speed," he said. PM added, "India's talent, technology, innovation and industry have made an identity for themselves before the world."

6.title: 'CM uncle' build toilets before painting K'taka schools: Congress
6.article_body: Expressing dissent over the proposed Viveka scheme by the state government, under which newly built classrooms will be painted in saffron colour, Congress said that CM Basavaraj Bommai should build toilets first. "CM uncle, before painting school buildings in saffron, first build toilets, give us hygienic drinking water and facilities that would attract children to schools," Congress tweeted.

7.title: 2,000 classrooms constructed in Kalyana Karnataka region: Bommai
7.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday announced the construction of 2,000 classrooms in Kalyana Karnataka region. The government has decided to construct additional classrooms in this region to solve the issue of shortage of classrooms for primary and secondary education, Bommai said. He added that ₹250 crore has been released towards construction and repairs of toilets in government schools.

8.title: Eating ultra-processed foods linked to premature death: Study
8.article_body: The consumption of highly processed foods can be linked to premature deaths, a study stated. As per researchers, ultra-processed foods (UPFs) like packaged baked snacks, ready-to-eat meals, frozen pizza, sugary drinks and cereals can cause adverse health conditions like obesity, dementia, and cancer. UPFs are low in protein and fibre, and heavy in added sugar, fat and salt, researchers added.

9.title: Headless body of woman with limbs chopped off found inside UP well
9.article_body: A body of a woman was found inside a well with its limbs chopped off and head missing in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district on Tuesday, police said. "Efforts are being made to ascertain her identity after which details of age and her whereabouts would become clear," Azamgarh SP said. Forensic experts and dog squads had been called to the spot.

10.title: 2022 was a dream, might not happen again: Anupam on success of his films
10.article_body: Speaking about his successful run in films in 2022, Anupam Kher said the year was a dream for him that got fulfilled and might not happen again. Anupam featured in 2022 films like 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Karthikeya 2', which were successful at the box office. "I don't know which film of mine will do well next year," he added.

11.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a historic movement, will benefit Congress: Pilot
11.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Tuesday said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a historic movement that will benefit the Congress in the days to come. "Not just Congress supporters but...common people too are enthusiastic about the yatra," Pilot said. He added that BJP is upset because the yatra is getting huge support and will get "unexpected reception" in Rajasthan too.

12.title: MrBeast beats PewDiePie to become world's most-subscribed person on YouTube
12.article_body: American YouTube personality Jimmy Donaldson, better known as 'MrBeast', has overtaken Swedish YouTuber Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg (PewDiePie) to become the most-subscribed individual on YouTube. On Tuesday, MrBeast crossed 111.9 million subscribers against PewDiePie's over 111.8 million subscribers. India's T-Series remains the world's most subscribed YouTube channel with 229 million subscribers.

13.title: NASA to launch Artemis 1 Moon rocket on November 16
13.article_body: After two failed attempts, NASA is all set to launch its Artemis 1 Moon rocket on November 16. The mission's SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft will be launched from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida at 11.34 am IST. NASA will start live streaming of the tanking operations from 2 am IST on its official website, app and YouTube.

14.title: 55-yr-old woman dies due to suffocation at overcrowded temple in MP
14.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died due to suffocation at an overcrowded temple in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district on Tuesday. A large number of people had gathered to hear the sermons of a saint at the Dandraua Hanuman Mandir. Another woman was injured due to overcrowding and was taken to a health centre for treatment.

15.title: US woman caught twice with Mayan relics in Guatemala within a week
15.article_body: Two Americans have been arrested in Guatemala after police allegedly found 166 Mayan artefacts from the car they were travelling in, authorities said on Monday. One of the accused, a woman, was caught just a few days ago, on Thursday, trying to smuggle two Mayan relics out of the country, officials said. She was arrested and subsequently released on bail.

16.title: We opened over 320 mn bank accounts in India, more than US population: PM in Bali
16.article_body: PM Narendra Modi highlighted the achievements of his government in India while interacting with the Indian diaspora in Bali. Saying that India is the fastest-growing economy in the world today, PM Modi said, "Since 2014, we have opened more than 320 million bank accounts. More than the population of the USA." He added, "We don't dream small anymore."

17.title: Abhishek Bachchan says he keeps a scrapbook of bad reviews, criticisms
17.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan revealed that he keeps a scrapbook of bad reviews and criticisms that come his way. He added the idea came from his father Amitabh Bachchan. "He said 'Read it every day and...prove them wrong...use that as inspiration.' I took it a step further and made it 'They're telling...to improve...so let me read...on how to improve myself'," said Abhishek.

18.title: BJP fields former MLA Ashok Pincha for Sardarshahar bypoll in Raj
18.article_body: BJP on Tuesday announced former MLA Ashok Kumar Pincha as its candidate for the bypoll to the Sardarshahar Assembly constituency in Rajasthan. The seat got vacant after the death of Bhanwarlal Sharma in October this year. Pincha contested the 2018 elections from Sardarshahar against Sharma but lost by a margin of over 16,000 votes.

19.title: Class 6 girl accidentally swallows safety pin while adjusting hijab in Nagpur
19.article_body: A Class 6 girl reportedly swallowed a safety pin while adjusting her hijab at school in Maharashtra's Nagpur. When she started feeling uneasy, her parents took her to Mayo hospital, where the doctors found out that the pin was stuck in her windpipe. Doctors performed a non-invasive bronchoscopy on her and took out the pin safely.

20.title: Fawad Khan's Legend of Maula Jatt becomes highest-grossing Pakistani film
20.article_body: Fawad Khan's 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' has become the highest-grossing Pakistani film of all time by beating 'Jawani Phir Nahi Ani 2'. The film has reportedly collected over PKR 170 crore worldwide. Directed by Bilal Lashari, 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' also featured Mahira Khan, Humaima Malick and Hamza Ali Abbasi, among others.

21.title: Utter nonsense to keep India favourites for 2023 ODI WC at home: Vaughan
21.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said it is "utter nonsense" to keep India favourites for 2023 ODI World Cup at home. "England will be the team to beat without any question and that is going to be the case for a few more years to come," added the ex-England captain. England won their second T20 World Cup title on Sunday.

22.title: Head hangs in shame: HC on non-payment of aide for sewer death victims
22.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday criticised the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) for not paying compensation to the families of two persons who died inside a sewer this year. DDA was directed to pay ₹10 lakh compensation each to the families of the deceased. "My head hangs in shame," said Chief Justice Satish Chandra Sharma.

23.title: Govt strict, unsparing in dealing with religious conversions: Chhattisgarh CM
23.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said his government is strict and unsparing when it comes to dealing with forcible religious conversions. "We're a democracy where everyone has the right to choose the religion that he or she wants to practice," Baghel said. "But if someone is forced into...conversion, there's a provision for strict action against them in our state," he added.

24.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' actor Mayur Vakani creates PM Modi's sculpture, shares pics
24.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Mayur Vakani, who plays the character Sundar, recently shared photos of the sculpture he has created of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Mayur took to his official Instagram account and shared a couple of photos in which he can be seen working on the sculpture. "'SELFIE WITH PM', final touch up," he captioned his post.

25.title: Watching Man Utd vs Arsenal with Anisha is interesting time: Ranveer
25.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is a fan of football club Arsenal, has said that his sister-in-law Anisha Padukone is a Manchester United fan and watching the match between the two is "always an interesting time". "I lucked out that both my best friends are also Arsenal fans because things can get out of hand during banter," he added.

26.title: CSK have a lot of work to do, Dhoni's best cricket is behind him: Harbhajan
26.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said going forward CSK have a lot of work to do, adding MS Dhoni's best cricket is behind him as well. "Yes, he's the best captain today also. If you make him stand as a captain, you will not get that value from any other captain," he added. CSK have won four IPL titles under Dhoni's captaincy.

27.title: Telangana CM inaugurates 8 newly-established govt medical colleges
27.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday virtually inaugurated the commencement of classes in eight new medical colleges in the state. With this, over 1,150 first year MBBS students began their medical education in towns including Sangareddy, Mahabubabad, Mancherial, Jagtial, Wanaparthy, Kothagudem, Nagarkurnool and Ramagundam. KCR called it a golden chapter in the history of Telangana state.

28.title: Chennai Super Kings retain Ravindra Jadeja ahead of IPL 2023
28.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) have retained all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja ahead of IPL 2023. Sharing a picture, CSK tweeted, "Eighth wonder to stay with us!" Jadeja, who was named CSK captain for IPL 2022, was replaced as captain mid-tournament. He was later ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury. Earlier, reports of rift between Jadeja and CSK had surfaced online.

29.title: Kerala govt issues alert in 7 districts as dengue cases spike
29.article_body: The Kerala government on Tuesday sounded an alert in seven districts of the state against the spread of dengue fever. State Health Minister Veena George said dengue cases were on the rise in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Palakkad, Kozhikode and Malappuram. The administration has planned weekly dry day campaigns by cleaning public places and homes and removing stagnant water.

30.title: Direct tax collection to exceed budget target by 25-30%: Tax Board chief
30.article_body: Central Board of Direct Taxes Chairman Nitin Gupta said the direct tax collection in the current fiscal is likely to exceed the budget target of ₹14.20 lakh crore by about 25-30%. A 25-30% growth would take the net direct tax collection to ₹17.75-₹18.46 lakh crore. Gupta added that the next budget could bring changes in TDS provision for online gaming.

31.title: MP Minister Pradhuman Tomar massages patients' feet; video surfaces
31.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Energy Minister Pradhuman Singh Tomar on Monday evening visited a cataract treatment camp in Gwalior and gave foot massages to elderly patients present there. A video of the incident showed Tomar interacting with a patient at the camp. Tomar stayed at the camp over the night, served breakfast to the patients on Tuesday and also ate with them.

32.title: PM Modi interacts with Chinese Prez for 1st time since border clashes, pics released
32.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday interacted with Chinese President Xi Jinping during the G20 gala dinner in Indonesia's Bali. This is the first time the two leaders were seen interacting face-to-face since the clashes along the India-China border in 2020. PM Modi and Jinping came face-to-face during the SCO Summit in Samarkand in September but there was no interaction.

33.title: I-T Dept raids 30 locations linked to Maha SP chief's close aides
33.article_body: The Income Tax Department has raided over 30 locations in Varanasi, Kanpur, Lucknow, Mumbai and Kolkata linked to Maharashtra SP President Abu Asim Azmi's close aides during a probe related to benami property investments and black money. The properties are linked to late Ganesh Gupta and his wife Abha Ganesh Gupta. Officials said some other politicians will also be investigated.

34.title: FTX says it could have over 1 million creditors in new bankruptcy filing
34.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX expects to have over 1 million individual creditors, the company said in its first bankruptcy filing. The documents revealed that FTX "faced a severe liquidity crisis", and was in contact with financial regulators. As per the filing, five new independent directors have been appointed at each of FTX's main companies, including trading firm Alameda Research.

35.title: 7 apes being smuggled in boxes from Myanmar rescued in Assam
35.article_body: Seven apes, allegedly smuggled in boxes from Myanmar, were rescued in Assam's Hailakandi district on Monday night, police said. Two people were arrested after police chased their vehicle for almost 10 kilometres. Police said the apes were smuggled through Mizoram and the consignment was going towards Meghalaya.

36.title: KTR seeks Centre's nod for Hyd Metro Phase II project worth ₹8,000 cr
36.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) has requested the central government to provide preliminary clearance for the Hyderabad Metro Phase II project. He urged Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri to include the project in the ensuing union budget for fiscal year 2023-24. The new metro line from BHEL to Lakdikapul, estimated to cost ₹8,453 crore, will include 23 stations.

37.title: Probe against promoter will not impact Jet Airways deal: Kalrock Capital
37.article_body: Kalrock Capital said the ongoing investigation related to its promoter Florian Fritsch in foreign jurisdictions will have no impact on the acquisition of Jet Airways. Last week, multiple properties linked to Fritsch were raided by prosecutors in a criminal investigation. Kalrock-Jalan consortium had won the bid to revive Jet Airways after the airline filed for bankruptcy in 2019.

38.title: SEBI amends rules for appointment, removal of independent directors
38.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) introduced a new option for the appointment and removal of independent board of directors, for flexibility in the approval process. As per the new rule, the appointment and removal of independent directors could be done by two thresholds, ordinary resolution and majority of minority shareholders. Currently, it's done through a special resolution.

39.title: Today's fertilizer shortage is tomorrow's food crisis: PM Modi at G-20
39.article_body: During his address at the G-20 summit, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Today's fertilizer shortage is tomorrow's food crisis, for which the world will not have a solution." "We should build mutual agreement to maintain the supply chain of both manure and food grains stable and assured," he added. PM Modi was addressing a session on food and energy security.

40.title: Unimaginable shame: Murthy on 70 kids' death from India-made syrups in Gambia
40.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said that the death of 70 children in Gambia from India-made cough and cold syrups brought "unimaginable shame" to the country. He added it dented the credibility of India's pharmaceutical regulatory agency. He also stressed that India faces huge challenges in the field of research in sciences.

41.title: Govt asks state-owned firms to consider insolvency court to shut units
41.article_body: The Central Government has asked state-owned firms to consider moving the country's insolvency court to shut loss-making units, hoping for speedier resolutions. Public sector companies will have to file an insolvency application under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code for the resolution of a loss-making unit within three months of approval from a committee comprising top cabinet ministers.

42.title: Which players have been released by CSK ahead of IPL 2023 auction?
42.article_body: Chennai Super Kings, who finished ninth in IPL 2022, have released eight players from their squad and retained 18 players. Dwayne Bravo, Adam Milne, Chris Jordan, N Jagadeesan, C Hari Nishaanth, K Bhagath Varma, KM Asif and Robin Uthappa have been released. Uthappa had retired from all forms of Indian cricket on September 14.

43.title: Mamata Banerjee serves pakoras at roadside tea stall in WB; video surfaces
43.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stopped her convoy at a roadside tea stall in Jhargram and started serving pakoras to people. A video of the incident showing Banerjee wrapping the pakoras in paper and handing them out to people has surfaced online. She visited Jhargram to celebrate the birth anniversary of tribal freedom fighter Birsa Munda on Tuesday.

44.title: 6 injured as car hits e-rickshaw near Noida's Amity University
44.article_body: Two college students were taken into police custody after their car hit an e-rickshaw in Noida, injuring six people, including two school girls, an official said. The incident took place around 8:30 am near Amity University, the official said. Out of the six injured people, three suffered severe injuries for which they were hospitalised, said DCP (Noida) Harish Chander.

45.title: Delhi HC issues notice on lack of equipment in veterinary hospitals
45.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has issued a notice on the lack of equipment in the 77 government veterinary hospitals and dispensaries in the city. The notice was issued after the court heard a public interest litigation by three social workers who sought directions for the Veterinary Council of India, the Delhi government and the Animal Welfare Board of India.

46.title: Belief that my films will be superhits makes me work 18 hrs a day: SRK
46.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said he has faith that all his upcoming films will be successful at the box office. "I'd like to explain the lack of arrogance in this statement...That is the belief that makes me, at the age of 57, go do stunts, jump, work 18 hours a day," he added. SRK will next feature in 'Pathaan'.

47.title: It is very exciting when you have ability to bowl 150 plus: Kane on Umran
47.article_body: New Zealand batter Kane Williamson said that Indian pacer Umran Malik is a super exciting talent. "Spent time with him (Umran) last year and his raw pace was a real asset. Seeing him in the Indian international scene is an amazing rise," Williamson said. "When you have the ability to bowl 150 plus, it is very exciting," he added.

48.title: 2,012 candidates file nomination papers for MCD elections: Report
48.article_body: As many as 2,012 candidates filed their nomination papers for the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections, PTI reported. In total, 2,564 nominations were received by the election officials. The elections will be held on December 4 and counting will take place on December 7. In 2017, the BJP won 181 wards of the 270 wards in total.

49.title: 7 MBBS students suspended for allegedly ragging juniors in Uttarakhand
49.article_body: Seven MBBS students of a medical college in Uttarakhand's Srinagar were suspended for allegedly ragging their juniors. The incident took place on November 11. The accused had allegedly abused their juniors and forced them to strip on the hostel roof. A panel which was set up by the institute to look into the matter reportedly found the seven students guilty.

50.title: Several injured as crude bombs hurled in clash in WB's Birbhum; 12 arrested
50.article_body: Several people were injured, and 12 were arrested after crude bombs were hurled during a clash between two groups in West Bengal's Birbhum on Monday. Several crude bombs were seized from the area. While BJP alleged it was an intra-party clash within Trinamool Congress (TMC), the latter called it "an apolitical clash that was a result of a personal feud".

51.title: Recalibrate meters by Nov 30: RTO to Mumbai taxis, autorickshaws
51.article_body: Regional Transport Office (RTO) said Mumbai taxis and autorickshaws will face a daily fine if they fail to recalibrate their meters as per the new fare structure by November 30. Autos and taxis would also face a one-day permit suspension for each day's delay. Till last week, only 4% of taxis and 11% of autos had updated their meters.

52.title: Google launches UPI Autopay for subscription-based purchases in India
52.article_body: Google has introduced UPI Autopay as a payment option for subscription-based purchases on Google Play in India. Launched under UPI 2.0 by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI Autopay helps customers make recurring payments using any UPI application that supports the feature. UPI Autopay is available alongside the existing credit and debit card, net banking and other options.

53.title: Turkey plans to pursue targets in northern Syria: Report
53.article_body: Turkey plans to pursue targets in northern Syria after it completes a cross-border operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq, a senior Turkish official told Reuters on Tuesday, following Sunday's bomb blast in Istanbul. Turkey has blamed Kurdish militants for the blast. Ankara will clear threats along its southern border "one way or another", the official added, declining to be named.

54.title: Mumbai Indians release 13 players ahead of IPL 2023 auction
54.article_body: Mumbai Indians have released 13 players ahead of IPL 2023 auction. They included Kieron Pollard, Anmolpreet Singh, Aryan Juyal, Basil Thampi, Daniel Sams, Fabian Allen, Jaydev Unadkat, Mayank Markande, Murugan Ashwin, Rahul Buddhi, Riley Meredith, Sanjay Yadav and Tymal Mills. Mumbai Indians will have nine slots to fill in the auction with a remaining purse of ₹20.55 crore.

55.title: It is a surreal feeling: Singer Armaan Malik on winning second EMA
55.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has reacted after he won his second MTV Europe Music Award 2022 (EMA) for his song 'You' in the Best India Act category. "It is a surreal feeling...I'm humbled and overjoyed to win my second EMA," he stated. Armaan won his first EMA for his track 'Control'. Speaking about 'You', Armaan called it "a very special record".

56.title: SoftBank writes off $100 mn investment in bankrupt crypto firm FTX: Report
56.article_body: SoftBank has reportedly written off about $100 million it invested as part of its Vision Fund 2 in now bankrupt crypto exchange FTX. SoftBank had backed FTX after the startup raised $400 million in January. According to the report, Softbank CFO Yoshimitsu Goto said that the $100-million Vision Fund invested in FTX as a minor stake in the company.

57.title: 126 children infected with measles in Mumbai this year
57.article_body: A one-year-old boy has died of measles in Mumbai while 126 children have contracted the viral disease this year in the city. A BMC official said the boy was undergoing treatment at Kasturba Hospital in Chinchpokli since last week and died on Monday. Civic officials have appealed to get children in the 9-16 age group fully vaccinated against the disease.

58.title: 1 killed, 30 hurt as bus going to Prez Murmu's event in MP overturns
58.article_body: One person was killed and over 30 were injured after a bus ferrying people to President Droupadi Murmu's tribal event in Madhya Pradesh overturned. The injured were rescued with the help of villagers, reports said, adding that those in critical condition were sent to different places for treatment. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed grief over the incident.

59.title: LGBTQI+ activist Gopi beaten by group of men in Delhi, hospitalised
59.article_body: A group of unidentified men allegedly beat LGBTQI+ activist Gopi Shankar Madurai near the latter's home in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Saturday. The intersex activist is currently admitted in a hospital with injuries on various parts of their body. DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said Madurai has received minor injuries. In January, Madurai was assaulted by six people in Tamil Nadu.

60.title: WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose steps down
60.article_body: WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose has stepped down from his role "to pursue another opportunity". Rajiv Aggarwal, Director of Public Policy Meta India, has also stepped down. The developments come days after Meta announced its biggest layoffs ever by cutting down its workforce by 11,000 employees across the globe.

61.title: Pune woman tricked into giving jewellery worth ₹1.3 lakh by fraudster
61.article_body: A 71-year-old woman in Pune was allegedly tricked into giving her gold jewellery worth ₹1.3 lakh by a fraudster. The woman was returning from her morning walk when the accused stopped her and told her that she had won lottery on her purchase of sarees recently. He asked her to take off her ornaments for weighing them and ran away.

62.title: Man shot at by 3 bike-borne suspects in Gurugram's Badshahpur
62.article_body: A 22-year-old man was shot at by three unidentified bike-borne suspects in Gurugram's Badshahpur area on Monday. The incident happened at around 10.30 pm when the victim, Ankit, and his friend, Himanshu, were standing outside another friend's house in Guga Colony, police said. Ankit has sustained an injury in his left eye and his condition is critical, police added.

63.title: If you won't use someone at ₹9 cr, put him back in auction: Moody on Shahrukh
63.article_body: On being asked whether PBKS should retain Shahrukh Khan in IPL 2023 auction, Tom Moody said, "If you aren't going to use someone at ₹9 crore and he's sitting on...bench...you put him back into...auction." Moody added that PBKS can bring Shahrukh back in the squad at a lesser price. Shahrukh scored 117 runs in eight matches in IPL 2022.

64.title: SRH release their most expensive player Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023
64.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) have released their captain and most expensive player Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023. The 32-year-old, who was earning ₹14 crore, spent eight years with them. He played 76 matches for the franchise. SRH have also released Nicholas Pooran. Both Pooran and Williamson are the captains of their respective national teams.

65.title: Microsoft, IIT Kanpur incubator collaborate to support startups
65.article_body: IIT Kanpur's Startup Incubation and Innovation Centre collaborated with Microsoft to launch the 'Azure Society of Excellence' to support startups. Under the programme, Microsoft will work with the incubator and give mentorship, employment and entrepreneurial opportunities. Startups at IIT Kanpur can also access various Microsoft resources to support their business plan and product development.

66.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra's impact will be felt in 2024 polls: Cong's Jairam
66.article_body: The impact of Congress's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will be felt in 2024 Loksabha elections and not in Assembly elections, party leader Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. Addressing the media, he said, "You will ask, what will be its impact in Gujarat or Himachal polls. It won't have any." "The Yatra will promote togetherness, it has united our party," he added.

67.title: Hindustani Bhau calls Urfi's outfits 'inappropriate', she reacts
67.article_body: Urfi Javed has reacted after YouTuber Vikas Fhatak aka 'Hindustani Bhau' commented on her dressing style and said that her clothes are inappropriate and don't suit Indian culture. Urfi said, "Suddenly he has...problem with what I wear after I refused to give him media attention! Case closed! Verdict- publicity hungry a**holes who can stoop to any level to get fame."

68.title: Cold wave hits Odisha with G Udayagiri recording 7.2°C
68.article_body: A cold wave has hit Odisha, with G Udayagiri in Kandhamal district recording the lowest temperature of 7.2°C on Tuesday. Apart from this, Semiliguda in Koraput district recorded a temperature of 9°C. Moreover, 20 places across the state recorded temperatures below 15°C. While Phulbani in Kandhamal district recorded 10.5°C, Daringbadi in Kandhamal and Bhawanipatna in Kalahandi recorded 11°C.

69.title: Tech Mahindra to come out with moonlighting policy this month
69.article_body: Tech Mahindra is set to unveil its moonlighting policy for employees this month, according to Global Chief People Officer Harshvendra Soin. Soin said the company is evaluating permitting side gigs as long as they do not obstruct the work and is only for a short period, such as over the weekend or a couple of hours in the week.

70.title: BSNL expected to roll out 4G services from January
70.article_body: State-run telecom giant Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) is expected to roll out 4G services from January next year, CNBC TV-18 reported. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has bagged the tender for the construction of towers to enable the rollout of the service, the report added. TCS will reportedly install one lakh towers over the next two years.

71.title: Should I now fall at PM Modi's feet & ask for funds for WB?: Mamata
71.article_body: Criticising the Central government for not releasing funds for 100 days' work and housing scheme for West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee asked if she should now fall at PM Modi's feet to ask for money. "You will take our money and then deprive us. What if we stop paying the tax?" Banerjee asked while addressing a gathering in Jhargram.

72.title: IITs have become victims of rote learning: Infosys Co-founder Murthy
72.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said that IITs have become victims of "rote learning", the memorisation of things based on repetition. "Thanks to the tyranny of coaching classes," he added. Murthy said that students should be able to relate what they learn in the classroom to the real world around them rather than passing examinations by rote learning.

73.title: Infosys to end work-from-home for employees, brings 3-phase hybrid work plan
73.article_body: Infosys is asking its employees to start reporting to offices in phases, putting an end to its work-from-home policy, an internal communication revealed. In the first phase, employees will be asked to come to offices twice a week. After that, they can relocate to a branch of their choice. Finally, Infosys will determine a work policy based on the feedback.

74.title: Manoj Bajpayee's best performance yet: Anurag on 'Gali Guleiyan'
74.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has praised Manoj Bajpayee's performance in 'Gali Guleiyan'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote that it is Manoj's "best performance yet". Manoj, while announcing the OTT release of his film, had said he was on the verge of losing his mental stability while preparing for the role. The film is written, directed and produced by Dipesh Jain.

75.title: Apple's job listings hint at 'metaverse' plans for its headset: Reports
75.article_body: Apple is looking for engineers to build its own 'metaverse' for its yet-to-be-announced mixed-reality (MR) headset, Bloomberg first reported. Job listings from Apple's Technology Development Group show that the company is looking for people to make its virtual and augmented reality headset, and build a video service with 3D content. The company's development of the headset was reported in 2021.

76.title: No water for 6 days, Jal Board unresponsive: Delhi's Vasant Kunj residents
76.article_body: Residents of Delhi's Vasant Kunj, Sector C-8, have alleged that there has been no water supply in the area for the last six days. They also claimed that the Delhi Jal Board has not been responding to their phone calls and online complaints adding they're now dependent on water tankers. Angry residents also staged protests holding empty buckets on streets.

77.title: 70 tonnes of missile fuel component found on ship to Yemen: US Navy
77.article_body: The US Navy said on Tuesday it found 70 tonnes of a missile fuel component aboard a Yemen-bound ship from Iran. The amount of ammonium perchlorate discovered can fuel more than a dozen medium-range ballistic missiles, the navy added. Iranian-backed Houthi rebels have used such projectiles against Yemen's allies and the Saudi-led coalition in the Yemeni Civil War.

78.title: Meghalaya BJP leader Bernard gets bail in 3-yr-old girl's rape case
78.article_body: Meghalaya High Court has granted bail to jailed BJP leader Bernard N Marak in a case related to the alleged rape of a three-year-old girl at his farmhouse. The court asked him not to leave the country or try to tamper with the evidence. He was earlier granted bail in connection with the running of a brothel in the farmhouse.

79.title: Retired Mumbai doctor loses ₹2.2 lakh to electricity bill fraud
79.article_body: A retired microbiologist, Dr Jayanthi Shashtri, from Mumbai's BYL Nair Hospital, allegedly lost ₹2.24 lakh to electricity bill fraud. According to police, Shashtri got a link to update her electricity bill payment status. After she filled the form and provided details of her credit card, she lost money in three transactions of ₹24,999, and three other transactions of ₹49,801.

80.title: Mumbai Police announce traffic restrictions for Bal Thackeray's death anniversary
80.article_body: Ahead of Bal Thackeray's 10th death anniversary, Mumbai Traffic Police have announced traffic restrictions around Dadar's Shivaji Park on Wednesday. No vehicles will be allowed on Swatantra Veer Savarkar Marg, Rajabadhe Chowk Junction, Dilip Gupte Marg, and Senapati Bapat Road to Lady Jamshedji Marg. Also, parking will be restricted on Keluskar Road, MB Raut Marg, Pandurang Naik Marg etc.

81.title: Man says Chicha's in Hyd charges double for water bottles, shares bill
81.article_body: An RTI activist tweeted on Monday that Chicha's restaurant in Hyderabad is charging customers ₹20 for a 500-ml water bottle which is worth ₹10. Sharing the restaurant's bill, Robin Zaccheus tweeted, "Clear exploitation and...violation of MRP." In response, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said, "Officers have been alerted on this issue and the same will be resolved at the earliest."

82.title: NCP MLA Jitendra Awhad gets anticipatory bail in molestation case
82.article_body: A Thane court granted National Congress Party (NCP) MLA and former Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad anticipatory bail on Tuesday on a bond of ₹15,000 in a molestation case. Awhad was booked for outraging the modesty of a BJP woman leader, who alleged that he pushed her on November 13 during a public event.

83.title: Elephant falls into well, JCB razes wall to rescue it in Andhra; video surfaces
83.article_body: An elephant fell into a well in the Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh on Monday and was rescued on Tuesday. A video of the rescue operation shows a JCB razing down a portion of a wall to help it climb out of the well. The operation was carried out by a joint team of forest officials and the fire department.

84.title: Don't like to lie: Diljit Dosanjh to journalist asking him for interview
84.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh replied to a journalist on Twitter after the latter asked the actor for an interview on the social media platform. He tweeted, "I don't like interviews...I...avoid them as much as I can. I don't like to lie...listening to the truth is difficult." "We have to live in this society where the truth is often crucified," he added.

85.title: Uddhav's Shiv Sena broke alliance for 4 seats in 2014: Devendra Fadnavis
85.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) and claimed that the party was dishonest with the BJP. "[In 2014], we were ready to form an alliance with Shiv Sena. However, Shiv Sena broke alliance for four seats. [The] BJP, which was contesting 117 to 118 seats, decided to contest 288 seats in one day," said Fadnavis.

86.title: BJP doesn't want to accept tribals, poor should get rights: Rahul
86.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BJP "attacks" the Constitution every day because it doesn't want to accept that Dalits, tribals and poor should get rights. While addressing a public meeting in Maharashtra's Washim district, Gandhi said tribals are the "original owners of the country" and their rights come first before anyone.

87.title: Interstate private bus catches fire in Telangana's Nirmal, no casualties
87.article_body: A private bus headed to Hyderabad from Nagpur, carrying 29 people, caught fire in Telangana's Nirmal on Tuesday morning. No injuries or casualties were reported due to the fire. "The driver observed smoke from the engine cabin. He immediately stopped the bus and alerted the passengers...[who]...got down immediately," police said, adding that a case has been registered.

88.title: In a first, child born at T3's medical facility, Delhi airport shares pic
88.article_body: In the first such episode, a baby was born at the Medanta medical facility at Terminal 3 of Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi. "Welcoming the youngest passenger ever! Celebrating the arrival of the first baby at Terminal 3, Medanta facility. Mother and child, both are doing well," the Twitter handle of the airport posted on Tuesday.

89.title: Commercial acting isn't easy, dare you to do what Rajinikanth does: Abhishek
89.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said that there is "an elite skill-set required" for acting in commercial films. In response to critics who look down upon commercial acting, Abhishek said, "I dare anybody to do what Rajini uncle (Rajinikanth) does...It's not easy." He said he'll be "impressed" if someone can pull off 'Devdas' with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Madhuri Dixit's "elan and grace".

90.title: Bahamas appoints liquidators to oversee collapsed FTX's unit
90.article_body: Financial regulators in the Bahamas appointed liquidators to run collapsed crypto exchange FTX's unit in the country. This move comes just days after authorities said they were looking for any "criminal misconduct" by FTX. FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday after traders withdrew $6 billion from the platform in just 72 hours and Binance cancelled a proposed rescue deal.

91.title: Cyberabad Police bust fake Meghalaya university certificate racket
91.article_body: Cyberabad Police busted a fake certificate racket on Monday and arrested six people for issuing fake certificates of Mahatma Gandhi University, Meghalaya. They also seized cash worth ₹50,000, 157 memos and letter pads of various universities. This comes after the accused took ₹2.07 lakh from a victim for fake certificates. University Director Milie Goel, who's the prime accused, is absconding.

92.title: 'Why this bias?' Umar on Archana Gautam's comeback in Bigg Boss 16
92.article_body: Umar Riaz, who featured in 'Bigg Boss 15', reacted to Archana Gautam's comeback in 'Bigg Boss 16' on Twitter after she was evicted for choking co-contestant Shiv Thakare. Umar tweeted, "Why the rules were different for me?" He added, "I was pushed in the task for which I reciprocated but every blame was put on me. Why this bias?"

93.title: No change in reservation status of Gujjars, Bakarwals: J&K LG Manoj Sinha
93.article_body: According to J&K LG Manoj Sinha, the reservation granted to the Pahari community in the valley will have no effect on the quotas of the Gujjar and Bakarwal communities. "Some people are trying to mislead the communities for political reasons, but I again reiterate...that there will [be] no change in the reservation quotas of Gujjars, Bakarwals...and Sippis," said Sinha.

94.title: May have to stop paying GST if Centre doesn't clear state's dues: CM Mamata
94.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said that if the Centre does not clear the state's dues, it may have to stop paying Goods and Services Tax (GST). "They are not releasing MNREGA funds. The BJP government has to step down from power if it does not clear our dues," CM Banerjee added.

95.title: Receiving shocking death threats for my kids: German Health Minister
95.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach has said that death threats targeting him and his family have become a regular part of his life. "I am...receiving shocking death threats for my children. Unfortunately, I can't go outside in the evening without personal security," Lauterbach said. Earlier this year, investigators uncovered an anti-state group that was allegedly planning to kidnap Lauterbach.

96.title: Indian groom's male friends wear saree and bindi at his wedding in US; video viral
96.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media that showed two groomsmen of an Indian groom arriving at his wedding venue in the US in sarees and bindi. The video showed the two men in saree walking down Michigan Avenue with the bride and surprising the groom. "That is so wholesome. Absolutely adorable," an Instagram user commented on the video.

97.title: A guy once asked me 'Are you a hard worker, or a smart worker?': Ranveer on casting couch
97.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, while speaking about encountering casting couch, told Deadline, "This guy calls me to this seedy place and is like, 'Are you a hard worker, or a smart worker?'" "I didn't consider myself to be smart, so I said, 'I think I'm a hard worker.' He was like, 'Darling, be smart, be sexy'," Ranveer added.

98.title: MI change profile picture on their social media handles to pay tribute to Kieron Pollard
98.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) changed profile picture on their social media handles to pay tribute to Kieron Pollard, who announced his retirement from IPL today. The profile picture included a photo of Pollard with words 'Forever MI' written on it. Pollard played a total of 13 IPL seasons for MI, scoring 3,412 runs and taking 69 wickets.

99.title: Let's normalise crying at workplace: Sugar CEO Vineeta Singh
99.article_body: In a video from a podcast, Sugar Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh said, "Let's normalise crying at the workplace. It's self-expression, not a 'breakdown'." Singh, who shared the clip on her social media handles, added that normalising crying at a workplace for men and women would be a huge cultural shift that organisations with a lot of women can bring about.

100.title: Owl Labs raises $25 mn in Series C round led by HP Tech Ventures
100.article_body: Owl Labs, a US-based startup that develops AI-powered hardware, has secured $25 million in a Series C funding round led by HP Tech Ventures. The funding round saw participation from Sourcenext, Matrix Partners, Spark Capital and Playground Global. The company was founded in 2014 by Mark Schnittman and Max Makeev.

101.title: Hatman Killer video completely fake, request to not share it: Mumbai Police
101.article_body: After a video of 'Hatman Killer' showing a stabbing incident of a woman went viral, Mumbai Police took to Twitter to say that it is "completely fake". "We have confirmed the clip is completely fake [and] request all to not share it for it furthers chaos and panic," the police added. They used "Fake News Alert" and "Fact Check" hashtags.

102.title: Nice to see crucial roles written for Indian actors: Richa Chadha
102.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha said that she feels "nice" that "crucial roles" are being written for Indian actors in international projects. Richa is set to play the lead role in an Indo-British production, helmed by a British director. While the actress didn't reveal details of the project, she said, "The story is interesting and I really liked my character."

103.title: No merger with Chirag Paswan until he makes public apology: RLJP chief
103.article_body: RLJP chief Pashupati Kumar Paras rejected reports of his party merging with LJP (Ram Vilas) headed by Chirag Paswan. "For rapprochement to take place, Chirag will have to atone and make a public apology over his decision to fight 2020 Bihar Assembly election alone," Paras said. He also claimed that Chirag returned to NDA only after BJP took his permission.

104.title: Cat licence must, ₹500 fine in Pune if owners fail to clean faeces
104.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Tuesday made it mandatory for owners to get pet licences for their cats. After receiving several complaints about sanitation problems created by pets like cats, PCMC has also decided to impose a fine of ₹500 on the owners if they refuse to clean their pet cats' faeces.

105.title: UNGA calls upon Russia to make reparations in Ukraine for wrongful acts
105.article_body: The UN General Assembly (UNGA) voted on a resolution to recognise that Russia must make reparations for its conduct in Ukraine. The resolution, supported by 94 out of 193 members, stated that Russia "must bear the legal consequences of all of its...wrongful acts, including making reparation for the injury...damage". Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called the resolution an "important" one.

106.title: Jacqueline Fernandez gets bail in ₹200-crore money laundering case
106.article_body: Delhi's Patiala House Court on Tuesday granted bail to actress Jacqueline Fernandez in the ₹200-crore money laundering case that involved conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. She was granted bail on a personal bond of ₹2 lakh and one surety of the same amount. The actress can travel abroad with prior permission of court.

107.title: BWF World Tour Finals moved from Guangzhou to Bangkok due to COVID-19
107.article_body: The upcoming BWF World Tour Finals has been moved from Guangzhou, China, to Bangkok, Thailand, due to COVID-19 situation in the Chinese city, Badminton World Federation announced on Tuesday. The tournament will begin on December 7, a week earlier than originally scheduled. This is due to stadium availability and a consequence of the change in location.

108.title: Amazon launches virtual healthcare space Amazon Clinic in US
108.article_body: Amazon.com on Tuesday launched Amazon Clinic, which is a virtual platform for common healthcare conditions such as allergies, acne and asthma, in the US. This is a move towards expanding the e-commerce giant's presence in the US healthcare space. This development comes only months after it agreed to buy primary care provider One Medical for $3.49 billion.

109.title: Our James Bond: Andhra Pradesh CM on demise of Telugu actor Krishna
109.article_body: Condoling the demise of the veteran Telugu actor Krishna, Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy said that Mahesh Babu's father was "our James Bond". CM Reddy said that his demise is a great loss for the Telugu people and the film industry. Krishna passed away in Hyderabad after suffering from cardiac arrest.

110.title: Foreign currency worth ₹1.52 cr seized by DRI at Amritsar, Chandigarh airports
110.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence sleuths seized foreign currency worth ₹1.52 crore from three passengers at the Amritsar and Chandigarh airports. At Amritsar International Airport, foreign currency worth ₹1.08 crore, hidden in cavities made in the luggage of two Dubai-bound passengers, was seized. In Chandigarh, foreign currency worth ₹44 lakh was seized from another Dubai-bound passenger.

111.title: Body found stuffed inside suitcase at Jalandhar railway station
111.article_body: The body of a man was found stuffed inside a suitcase outside a railway station in Punjab's Jalandhar on Tuesday. A passerby had reportedly informed the police about the suitcase. "We're scanning the CCTV footage in which a man in his mid-30s was seen dropping the suitcase and heading towards the ticket counter," ACP of the Government Railway Police said.

112.title: Ayushmann to join Dinesh Vijan-Amar Kaushik's horror universe
112.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana will be joining producer Dinesh Vijan and director Amar Kaushik's horror universe. Confirming the news, Ayushmann said, "It (the project) is very interesting and intriguing. It is very new for the Indian audience. So, let's see when it happens." The film is reportedly titled 'Vampire' with Samantha Ruth Prabhu as the female lead.

113.title: Only teams with big talent pools can have format-specific players: Kane
113.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said that only teams with big talent pools can have different players for red-ball and white-ball cricket formats. "With the volume of cricket happening, that is definitely a challenge...for the players...[and] support staff...You are always trying to balance that out and make sure guys are fresh," Williamson said.

114.title: BJP will break all records in Gujarat Assembly polls: Amit Shah
114.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Union Minister Amit Shah exuded confidence in the win of the BJP by a thumping majority and claimed that the party will break all the records. "[BJP] will form the government…The leadership of PM Modi and CM Bhupendra Patel is giving pace to development work. Gujarat’s law and order situation has improved," said Shah.

115.title: UN probes Germany's allegations of surveillance by Egypt at COP27
115.article_body: The UN Department of Safety and Security (UNDSS) is investigating allegations that COP27 host Egypt was "monitoring" participants. This comes after Germany complained to the Egyptian government that monitoring had allegedly taken place at its pavilion. The head of the Egyptian delegation, Wael Aboulmagd, denied reports of monitoring, saying, "It seems ludicrous because that's an open event."

116.title: China factory output slowed in Oct, retail sales fell 1st time since May
116.article_body: China's industrial output rose by 5% in October from a year earlier, slowing from the 6.3% seen in September, official data showed on Tuesday, as COVID-19 restrictions weighed on factory activity. Retail sales fell for the first time since May when Shanghai was under a city-wide COVID-19 lockdown. Sales dropped by 0.5% compared with a 2.5% gain in September.

117.title: PM Modi receives warm welcome at Indian community event in Bali
117.article_body: PM Narendra Modi received a warm welcome as he attended an Indian community event in Bali on Tuesday. Indian community chanted slogans of "Modi, Modi" as he reached the venue. PM Modi said India and Indonesia are united through cultures and traditions. "If India has...Himalayas, Indonesia has Mount Agung and if India has Ganga, Indonesia has Tirta Gangga," he added.

118.title: When she complained of pain, hospital dropped her home: Chennai footballer's coach
118.article_body: The coach of 18-year-old footballer R Priya, who died after alleged botched surgery in Chennai, said when she started complaining of pain, the hospital dropped her home in an ambulance and left immediately. He added that the hospital operated on her even though they didn't have a specialist. "They should have sent her to the government hospital immediately," he said.

119.title: Binance to form crypto recovery industry fund: CEO after FTX collapse
119.article_body: Binance, world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, is "forming an industry recovery fund, to help projects who are otherwise strong, but in a liquidity crisis", announced CEO Changpeng Zhao. Stating they wanted to reduce further cascading negative effects of FTX, he welcomed other industry players who want to co-invest. "Crypto is not going away. We are still here. Let's rebuild," Zhao tweeted.

120.title: Congress releases list of star campaigners for Gujarat elections
120.article_body: The Congress party released its list of star campaigners for upcoming Gujarat elections today. The list has 40 names including that of party chief Mallikarjun Kharge, UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, party MP Rahul Gandhi, General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Ashok Gehlot, Bhupesh Baghel, Sachin Pilot, Jignesh Mevani and Kanhaiya Kumar are some of the other names mentioned in the list.

121.title: Navi Mumbai sub-inspector booked on charges of raping policewoman
121.article_body: Navi Mumbai Police have booked a sub-inspector for allegedly raping a woman police officer. The accused and the victim are in their early 30s and unmarried, police said, adding they met during police training a few years ago and were in a relationship. The woman alleged that the accused promised marriage only to maintain physical relations with her, police added.

122.title: Sensex rises 248 points to end at 61,872, its all-time high on closing basis
122.article_body: The BSE Sensex on Tuesday rose 248 points to 61,872, its highest ever on a closing basis while the Nifty50 index settled at 18,403, its third-highest close ever. ONGC, Bharti Airtel and Hero Motocorp were among the top gainers of Nifty50 while HDFC Life Insurance and ITC were among the top laggards. The rupee closed at 81.10 per US dollar.

123.title: A great loss to Telugu film industry: Rajinikanth on actor Krishna's death
123.article_body: Rajinikanth took to Twitter to mourn the demise of veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna. "The demise of Krishna garu is a great loss to...Telugu film industry...working with him in 3 films are memories I will always cherish," he wrote. Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi wrote, "This is sad beyond words. It is unbelievable that the superstar Krishna has left us."

124.title: Delhi Police arrests gang producing fake life-saving cancer drugs
124.article_body: An international racket involved in the manufacturing of fake life-saving cancer drugs was busted and seven people, including two engineers and a doctor, were arrested, said RS Yadav, Special CP (crime), Delhi Police. Fake medicines valued at ₹8 crore were recovered, Yadav said, adding that the racket was operational for the last three-four years.

125.title: HDFC to raise up to ₹5,500 crore via bonds on Thursday
125.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC Limited will raise up to ₹5,500 crore by issuing bonds on a private placement basis. The secured redeemable non-convertible debentures (NCDs) issue will have a base size of ₹4,000 crore with an option to retain an oversubscription of up to ₹1,500 crore. The bond issue will open on Thursday and close on the same day.

126.title: Aditya Chopra rejected 'Chak De!' title track 6-7 times: Sulaiman
126.article_body: Music composer Sulaiman Merchant said that he and Salim Merchant made 6-7 versions of the title track of 'Chak De! India', which were rejected by Aditya Chopra. He recalled that Salim was ready to quit the film after another rejection. However, Sulaiman said that when lyricist Jaideep Sahni worked on the song, it got approved by Aditya.

127.title: Bhupendra Patel will undoubtedly be CM when BJP gets majority in Guj: Shah
127.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said when BJP gets a majority in upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls, incumbent CM Bhupendra Patel will "undoubtedly" return to the post. Shah stated that BJP will increase both its vote share and the number of seats by a record margin. "The people of Gujarat have never accepted the concept of a third party," he added.

128.title: BJP MLA demands 'Love Jihad' probe into Shraddha Walkar murder case
128.article_body: Reacting to the gruesome murder of Shraddha Walkar, BJP MLA Ram Kadam said that he will write a letter to the Delhi Police asking them to probe the matter from a possible "Love Jihad" angle. Ram Kadam and his supporters staged a protest in Mumbai against Walkar’s live-in partner. The accused killed Walkar in Delhi on May 18 this year.

129.title: President Murmu pays tribute to tribal icon Birsa Munda in Jharkhand
129.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday arrived in Jharkhand and paid tribute to tribal icon Birsa Munda in Ulihatu on his birth anniversary. Birsa Munda's birth anniversary is celebrated as 'Janjatiya Gaurav Divas'. "Visiting...places associated with his birth and work is like a pilgrimage for me," the President tweeted. She also extended wishes to people of Jharkhand on State Foundation Day.

130.title: Mumbai man who wanted to clear dues of ₹450 with cab company loses ₹1 lakh
130.article_body: A 42-year-old Mumbai resident, who wanted to clear his payment of ₹450 for a ride taken through a cab company, lost ₹1 lakh to a cyber fraudster. It happened after the victim found a fake customer care number on the internet. The fraudster, on the pretext of helping the victim, urged him to download an application and cheated him.

131.title: US tourist goes missing while hiking in Himachal Pradesh
131.article_body: A US tourist on a meditational retreat has gone missing while hiking in Dharamshala in Himachal Pradesh. Kangra SP Dr Kushal Chand Sharma said he informed the owner of the camp, where he was staying, on November 8 that he lost his way. "We have also deployed a dog squad and drone cameras to trace him," Sharma added.

132.title: Russian firm's code was used in US Army, CDC apps: Report
132.article_body: Thousands of apps on Apple and Google's online stores contain computer code developed by a Russian technology firm, Pushwoosh, that presents itself as a US-based company, Reuters has found. The US CDC said it removed Pushwoosh's code from seven public-facing apps after learning about the company's origin. The US Army said it removed an app containing Pushwoosh code in March.

133.title: Producer had unleashed his dog on me for fun during party, says Ranveer
133.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh revealed that a producer, whom he didn't name, had once unleashed his dog on him for fun during a private party. Ranveer added the producer is no more. He stated the producer had invited him to the party for a meeting. "It was that period that makes me value the opportunities I have now," he added.

134.title: We haven't made many good films in last year: Rao on Bollywood's performance
134.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, opening up about the performance of Bollywood movies, said, "We keep saying that Hindi cinema isn't doing well, but we've not made...many good films in the last year." "So, there's no point in wondering kyu nahi chal rahi hai (why is it not working). I think we need to push the envelope," he added.

135.title: Elephant falls into well in Andhra Pradesh, rescued with JCB's help
135.article_body: An elephant was rescued after it fell into a well in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor on Monday night. A video that has surfaced online shows a JCB machine demolishing a portion of the well's wall to make a slope. In the video, the elephant can be seen anxiously moving around inside the well and trying to climb up the wall.

136.title: US decision to probe Akleh's death is mistake, we won't cooperate: Israel
136.article_body: Israel has called the US investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh "a mistake", adding that the country will not cooperate with the probe. "We stand by the IDF's (Israel Defence Forces) soldiers...will not cooperate with an external investigation," Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz said. Akleh was killed while reporting at a refugee camp in Jenin.

137.title: India's trade deficit widens to $26.91 billion in October
137.article_body: India's October merchandise trade deficit widened to $26.91 billion from $25.71 billion in September, according to export and import data released by the government on Tuesday. The data showed that India's merchandise exports fell to $29.78 billion from $35.45 billion in September. Merchandise imports declined to $56.69 billion from $61.16 billion in the same period, the data showed.

138.title: Chinese tech giant Tencent begins a new round of layoffs: Report
138.article_body: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings has begun a new round of layoffs, Reuters reported on Tuesday. The layoffs are targeted at its video streaming, gaming and cloud units, the report added. In August, Bloomberg reported that Tencent's workforce was reduced for the first time in nearly a decade as it let go of nearly 5,500 workers.

139.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra above politics, not to garner votes: Cong's Jairam
139.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said Bharat Jodo Yatra is not connected with any vote bank. "Its aims are above politics...it's not to garner votes," Ramesh added. "This yatra is promoting door-to-door contact which we had forgotten. We had forgotten as we were in power but we're remembering it with this yatra now," he stated.

140.title: Fire in footwear basement in Mumbai; no injuries reported
140.article_body: A fire erupted in a basement at the Shivashish Complex in the Chembur area of Mumbai on Monday. According to the Mumbai Fire Brigade, the fire broke out at 10:45 pm in the basement that was used for storage purposes by a shoe company. However, no injuries have been reported yet and the cause of the fire is still unknown.

141.title: Pune man posts threatening video of sickle on social media; arrested
141.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested in Pune on Sunday for allegedly posting a threatening video of a sickle on social media. The accused, Shubham Abhiman Jadhav, is a resident of the Thergaon area of Pimpri-Chinchwad. Jadhav's video went viral online, creating fear among the area's residents. He has been booked for possession of arms, police said.

142.title: Residents complain of heavy dust pollution in Mumbai's Mulund
142.article_body: Residents of Swapna Nagari in Mumbai's Mulund have complained of heavy dust pollution in the area, which they claim is the result of the ongoing construction work and a ready-mix concrete plant right next to their buildings. "The pollution has caused constant breathing and coughing problems," a resident said. They said they've also approached BMC regarding the issue.

143.title: Ton of flaws: Twitter employee on graph shared by Musk on Twitter's popularity
143.article_body: A Twitter employee who's on the Data Science team at Twitter called out Twitter's new owner Elon Musk after he shared a graph showing the platform's increased daily active users after his takeover. "Recent trend is promising," Musk tweeted. However, the Twitter employee tweeted, "I can say with certainty this graph has a ton of flaws in its calculation."

144.title: Delhi Police to seek Aftab's profile details from Bumble dating app
144.article_body: The Delhi Police is likely to write to the 'Bumble' dating app to seek Aftab Poonawala's profile details to find out about the women who visited him. Aftab, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, met her on Bumble. Delhi Police have already recovered 12 suspected body parts disposed of by Aftab.

145.title: School teacher arrested over FB posts against Karnataka minister
145.article_body: A school teacher has been arrested on charges of provocation and incitement to violence over social media posts against Karnataka Water Resources Minister Govind Karjol. The teacher allegedly asked about the absence of the BJP leader from his constituency in Mudhol on Facebook. Karjol is a five-time MLA from Mudhol in Bagalkot and a former deputy chief minister.

146.title: World population hits 8 billion, India to surpass China as most populated nation in 2023
146.article_body: The global human population crossed 8 billion on Tuesday, according to the UN. Meanwhile, India is projected to surpass China as the world’s most populous country in 2023. Amid falling growth rates, global population is projected to peak around 10.4 billion in the 2080s, the UN stated. The population has doubled from 4 billion in a span of 48 years.

147.title: India biggest contributor in reaching 8-bn world population mark, added 177 mn people
147.article_body: India was the biggest contributor to the world population's growth from 7 billion to 8 billion, the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) said. Notably, India's population will surpass China's in 2023. India added 177 million people while China, the second largest contributor to the 8 billion people milestone, added 73 million people to the world.

148.title: India didn't win T20 WC 2022 semis as their bowling had an off day: Uthappa
148.article_body: Reflecting on India's 10-wicket loss in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, Robin Uthappa said the only reason they didn't win was because their bowling had an off day against England. "It was a timid kind of effort with bat and ball," he added. Uthappa further said that India were successful until the semi-final because they bowled so well.

149.title: Three encounters in Noida within six hours; four arrested
149.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have arrested four men, including a Ghaziabad history-sheeter, after three encounters in Noida in the span of six hours from Monday night to early hours of Tuesday. The first encounter took place in Noida Sector 98 with a robber. The second encounter took place in Jarcha jurisdiction and the third encounter in Sector 15A.

150.title: Man accused of stealing trade secrets, sending them to China arrested: Canada
150.article_body: An employee of a public utility firm in Canada, Hydro-Quebec, has been arrested and charged with espionage for allegedly trying to steal trade secrets and sending them to China. Yuesheng Wang, 35, is also accused of using a computer without authorisation and deception to gain trade secrets. According to the police, the firm dealt with battery-related materials.

151.title: Sai Silks gets SEBI's nod to float ₹1,200 crore IPO
151.article_body: Sai Silks (Kalamandir) Limited has received SEBI's approval to raise ₹1,200 crore through an IPO. The IPO consists of fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹600 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to 1,80,48,440 equity shares by promoters and promoter group entities. The company plans to use the proceeds to set up new stores and two warehouses and pay debts.

152.title: 2 timer-fitted IEDs found near police post in Jammu, destroyed
152.article_body: Two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) with timers fitted to them were found near a police post in Jammu on Monday, officials said. The district SSP said, "We can't rule out the possibility of [a] Pakistani drone having dropped the consignment." The IEDs, which were hidden inside a black backpack, were destroyed in a controlled explosion a day later.

153.title: Kotak Investment Advisors raises $500 mn for $1 bn real estate fund
153.article_body: Kotak Investment Advisors Ltd (KIAL) announced it has received a $500 million investment for its $1 billion real estate fund from a unit of the UAE-based Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA). KIAL, the asset management division of the Kotak Mahindra Group, said it has so far raised, managed or advised over $3.3 billion under its real estate fund series.

154.title: Jharkhand Police rescue abducted 16-year-old girl; accused arrested
154.article_body: The Jharkhand Police rescued a 16-year-old girl and arrested the accused, who had abducted the minor and taken her to Bengaluru. According to the girl's parents, the accused arrived on two motorcycles, barged into their house and took the girl forcefully with them. Reports suggest that the abduction was carried out in order to convert the girl's religion.

155.title: Class 10 B'luru girl ends life after being caught cheating in class test
155.article_body: A Class 10 student died by suicide at her home in Bengaluru on Sunday. The incident took place days after school teachers allegedly scolded Amrutha after catching her copying from a chit during a class test. The minor girl left behind a suicide note. Her parents and friends staged a protest at Mariam Nilaya School with her body on Monday.

156.title: Actor Naga Shaurya faints on sets of his film after cutting off water from his diet: Reports
156.article_body: Tollywood actor Naga Shaurya fainted on the sets of his upcoming film on Monday due to dehydration and exhaustion, said reports. The actor had been cutting off water from his diet for four days to show his ripped body in a fight scene, reports added. "His temperature spiked and he had fainted...but he's okay now," the report quoted a source.

157.title: RSS-linked magazine accuses Amazon of funding religious conversions in India
157.article_body: The RSS-linked magazine "Organiser" has alleged that Amazon is sponsoring religious conversions in the country's northeast region and has also accused the company of getting involved in money laundering. "The American Baptist Mission is running a front in India known as the All India Mission. [It] has openly claimed...that they have converted 25,000 people to Christianity," the magazine said.

158.title: Can't believe such crime happened in neighbourhood: Shraddha's neighbour
158.article_body: Kusum Lata, a woman living in the same area as Shraddha Walkar and Aftab Poonawalla, said, "Nobody heard anything. It's just unbelievable." Her son said police asked for his help to bring down the fridge. "I was shocked and could not believe my ears when one of the journalists told me about the crime," another neighbour said.

159.title: Maybe, maybe not: Shubman Gill on whether he is dating Sara Ali Khan
159.article_body: During a recent Punjabi talk show, cricketer Shubman Gill was asked whether he is dating actress Sara Ali Khan. "Maybe, maybe not," the batter responded. Earlier in August, a video had gone viral on social media showing the duo at a restaurant together. Shubman was rumoured to be dating Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara Tendulkar earlier.

160.title: Get out of Ukraine: UK PM Rishi Sunak to Russia at G20 summit
160.article_body: Telling Russia to "get out of Ukraine" during the G20 summit in Bali, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, "It is notable that Putin didn't feel able to join us here. Maybe if he had, we could get on with sorting things out." The summit is being attended by Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.

161.title: Why was contract given to Ajanta without any tenders?: Gujarat HC on Morbi bridge collapse
161.article_body: Gujarat High Court on Tuesday questioned the manner in which contract for renovation of the Morbi bridge, which collapsed killing 135 people, was granted to the Ajanta Manufacturing Private Limited of the Oreva Group. The court noted, "The agreement signed between Morbi civic body and a private contractor is just 1.5 pages. Why contract was granted without inviting any tender?"

162.title: Uday Kotak's son not in race to lead Kotak Mahindra Bank: Firm's whole-time director
162.article_body: Billionaire Uday Kotak's son, Jay, isn’t in the running to lead Kotak Mahindra Bank, said KVS Manian, the firm's Whole-Time Director, during an interview. He added, "Jay is still young. He will have to work his way up on merit." Kotak has been the bank's CEO for over 18 years now and his current tenure will end in December 2023.

163.title: BJP MP threatens to demolish Mysuru bus stand with dome-like structures
163.article_body: BJP MP Pratap Simha on Monday threatened to demolish a bus stand in Karnataka's Mysuru which has dome-like structures on it. "I've seen pictures on social media of a bus stop with domes...It's a masjid," he said. He added that he has told engineers to demolish the structure and if they don't, he will take a JCB and demolish it.

164.title: My private pics were leaked by my ex-fiancé: Pakistani actress Rida Isfahani
164.article_body: While speaking about her 2016 MMS scandal, Pakistani actress Rida Isfahani has revealed that her ex-fiancé leaked her private pictures. "My trust was broken by my fiancé. I had convinced my parents for him, and my mindset was conservative so I wanted to be with only one person. Three years after our engagement, he leaked my pictures," she said.

165.title: My father used to think I'm wasting my aptitude in Bollywood: Radhika
165.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said that her father wasn't supportive of her Bollywood career and used to think that she's "wasting" her aptitude. "But he's very excited about me trying to write or...make things," she shared. Radhika added that her mother wanted to be an actress and she has "really backed" her Bollywood dreams.

166.title: Parts of Bengaluru to witness power cuts till Thursday
166.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from Tuesday to Thursday this week as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM)  will be undertaking some periodical repair and maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. Some of the areas which will remain affected today are - feeder areas of Davanagere, Court Road and Mahila Complex.

167.title: Sandals worn by Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs sold for ₹1.78 crore
167.article_body: A pair of Birkenstock sandals worn by late Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs were sold for $218,750 (around ₹1.78 crore) at an auction in the US. The "well-used" brown suede sandals dating to the mid-1970s set a record for the highest price ever paid for a pair of sandals. The sandals' cork and jute footbed retain the imprint of Jobs' feet.

168.title: Which states have highest active COVID cases as India sees lowest daily cases in 2.5 yrs?
168.article_body: Kerala has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases as India reported lowest daily cases in 2.5 years on Tuesday. Kerala is followed by Karnataka (1764), Maharashtra (962), Tamil Nadu (674) and Gujarat (343). India reported 474 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to latest government data.

169.title: Consumer food brand Yu raises ₹20 crore in Series A funding
169.article_body: Consumer food brand Yu raised ₹20 crore in a Series A funding in a mix of equity and venture debt, in a round led by investor Ashish Kacholia. Existing investors Manish Choksi and Varun Vakil of the Asian Paints Promoter Group and DPIIT's Startup India Seed Fund Scheme, which approved Yu under its ₹945-crore programme, also participated in the round.

170.title: G20 considers resolution with most members condemning war in Ukraine
170.article_body: G20 leaders considered a draft resolution in which most members strongly condemned the Russian war of Ukraine and stressed that the war was exacerbating fragilities in the global economy. The 16-page draft declaration mentioned that "recognising that the G20 is not the forum to resolve security issues, we acknowledge that security issues can have significant consequences for the global economy".

171.title: Hrithik Roshan starts 'Fighter' shoot, shares pic with director Siddharth
171.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan has begun the shooting of his upcoming film 'Fighter', which stars him along with Deepika Padukone. On Monday, the makers shared a picture of Hrithik and director Siddharth Anand on Instagram with "And it begins" as its caption. The actor is reportedly shooting for the film in Assam. Deepika and Anil Kapoor will reportedly join him soon.

172.title: UK PM extends support to Ukraine at G20, urges Putin to 'end barbaric war'
172.article_body: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak extended his support to Ukraine at the G20 summit and called upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to "end this barbaric war". Sunak called the Russian invasion of Ukraine "illegal". Last week, Britain said it would soon complete the delivery of 1,000 additional surface-to-air missiles to the Ukraine's armed forces.

173.title: The amount that I torture myself is next level: Musk to leaders wanting to be like him
173.article_body: Responding to a query about what business leaders should do to become like him, Elon Musk said, "Be careful about what you wish for...The amount that I torture myself is next level, frankly." Speaking about his increased workload after Twitter's acquisition, Musk said that while he's working "morning to night, seven days a week", it isn't something that he recommended.

174.title: Supporters of Shinde & Thackeray clash in Maha, video surfaces
174.article_body: A video has surfaced which shows Maharashtra Police resorting to lathi-charge after supporters of state CM Eknath Shinde and former CM Uddhav Thackeray clashed with each other in Thane. Shinde's supporters were seen shouting slogans like, "Eknath Shinde angar hai, baki sab bhangar hai." Both groups have levelled allegations against one another and FIRs have been filed against both.

175.title: Kieron Pollard announces retirement from IPL, becomes MI's batting coach
175.article_body: All-rounder Kieron Pollard has announced his retirement from IPL after playing for MI for 13 seasons. "It hasn't been...easiest decision...as I intend to keep playing for a few more years...but following discussions with MI I've decided to call time on my IPL career," he said. He further stated he has agreed to take up the role of MI's batting coach.
