176.title: 8 months after farmer was killed, Pune police arrest key accused from Guj
176.article_body: Over eight months after a 38-year-old farmer was hacked to death in Pune's Junnar taluka, Pune Rural Police have arrested a key accused in the case from Gujarat. The accused changed his identity and looks. Rohidas Baburao Pable was killed in March, allegedly by five persons who attacked him with sharp swords and sickles in front of his family members.

177.title: BMC to float fresh tenders by November end to concretise Mumbai roads
177.article_body: The BMC has confirmed that it will float fresh tenders for concretising roads of Mumbai by the end of November. "New tenders will be floated...at an approximately 20% higher cost, as there has been an exponential rise in the price of raw material, including cement and steel over the last three years," said a senior official.

178.title: Acting smart: Gujarat HC to Morbi civic body after it doesn't show up at hearing
178.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on Tuesday said that Morbi civic body is "acting smart" after it failed to appear before it at the bridge collapse hearing despite being served a notice. In October, over 130 people were killed after the suspension bridge collapsed in the city. The court had taken suo motu cognisance of the bridge collapse earlier this month.

179.title: BJP fields ex-MP Raghuraj Shakya against Dimple Yadav in Mainpuri by-poll
179.article_body: BJP on Tuesday named Raghuraj Singh Shakya, a former MP, as its candidate for the Lok Sabha by-poll in the Mainpuri seat of Uttar Pradesh against Samajwadi Party's Dimple Yadav. The election was necessitated after SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav's death in October. Shakya was once close to Shivpal Yadav but quit the Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) to join BJP.

180.title: BEST to run special bus services amid train traffic block on Nov 19-20
180.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport ( BEST) will run special bus services during the 27-hour train traffic block by Central Railway between CSMT and Masjid station in Mumbai. BEST will run 12 buses starting from 10.30 pm on Saturday (November 19) to 6.30 am on Sunday (November 20). It will run 35 additional buses on Sunday till 10 pm.

181.title: He'll live on through his work & lives he influenced: Krishna's family
181.article_body: Late legendary actor Krishna's family shared a statement expressing their "deepest grief" on the actor's death. "He was a superstar in so many ways beyond the movie screen...He'll live on through his work, through us, and many lives he influenced," the statement read. Krishna passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest. Pawan Kalyan, Chiranjeevi, Rajinikanth and others mourned Krishna's death.

182.title: World population crosses 8 billion
182.article_body: The global human population crossed 8 billion on Tuesday, according to the United Nations (UN). Amid falling growth rates, global population is projected to peak around 10.4 billion in the 2080s, the UN stated. Notably, the human population has doubled from 4 billion in a span of 48 years.

183.title: SoftBank to reduce stakes in Paytm, Policybazaar, Delhivery gradually: Report
183.article_body: Japanese venture investor SoftBank, whose holdings in Paytm, Policybazaar and Delhivery are currently worth $1.8 billion, will reportedly reduce its stake gradually over the next two years. SoftBank had cumulatively invested around $2.2 billion in these three companies and offloaded shares worth $560 million at their IPOs. This means it stands to gain around $160 million from these bets.

184.title: Some people don't work with me, are worried it may not be approved: Prakash Raj
184.article_body: Actor Prakash Raj said that some people do not want to work with him. "Not because they have been told not to...but they are worried 'they' may not approve. I am strong and rich enough to lose all that. I always feel my fear will be somebody's power," he added, while speaking about his political views impacting his work relationships.

185.title: Power utility CESC board approves proposal to raise ₹300 cr via NCDs
185.article_body: Power utility CESC said its board has approved a proposal to raise ₹300 crore through the issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs). The board approved the issue of 3,000 secured, unlisted, redeemable, rated NCDs having a face value of ₹10 lakh/each for cash at par aggregating to ₹300 crore, on a private placement basis, the company said in a BSE filing.

186.title: Twitter to remove device labels from tweets, Musk says 'No one knows why we did that'
186.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk said that the social media platform will stop adding labels that identify what kind of device has been used for tweeting. He wrote, "And we'll finally stop adding what device a tweet was written on (waste of screen space & compute) below every tweet. Literally, no one even knows why we did that."

187.title: 7 persons arrested for armed robbery worth ₹28 lakh in Pune
187.article_body: Seven persons were arrested by Pune City Police in connection with the daylight armed robbery of about ₹28 lakh at the office of an 'angadia', a private courier service system, in Market Yard area. On Saturday, robbers armed with weapons and a pistol barged into the office of PM Courier. One of them opened fire and they looted the cash.

188.title: Ukrainian President urges G20 nations to adopt its peace plan to end war
188.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has proposed a peace plan and urged the countries meeting at the G20 summit to step up their leadership and stop the Russian war in Ukraine. Zelenskyy reiterated that Russia must withdraw all its troops from Ukraine. He called for the release of all Ukrainian prisoners and also urged for restoration of "radiation safety".

189.title: ₹3 hike in milk, curd prices in Karnataka put on hold after CM's intervention
189.article_body: Karnataka Milk Federation's decision to hike the prices of milk and curd across the state has been put on hold after CM Basavaraj Bommai intervened. The decision, which increased milk and curd prices by ₹3, was supposed to come into effect today. Bommai said that a meeting will be held on November 20 to take a decision on price revision.

190.title: Ludhiana Police book man for stalking, harassing 42-year-old woman
190.article_body: The Ludhiana Police booked a man for stalking and harassing a 42-year-old woman. The accused has been identified as Happy Verma of Sukhdev Nagar, Jamalpur. The woman claimed that the accused used to stalk her and also created a fake account using her name on Instagram to post her pictures. The police launched a manhunt to arrest the accused.

191.title: 'Mother Heroine' award given to women with over 10 kids in Russia
191.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin handed out 'Mother Heroine' awards, months after reviving the Soviet-era title. As per the official decree reviving the award, the title is awarded to "a mother who is a citizen of the Russian Federation, who has given birth to and brought up ten or more children". Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov's wife is among the recipients.

192.title: District judges are not subordinates, need to change mindset: CJI
192.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud on Monday said judicial officers of the districts are not subordinate judges and underlined the need to change the mindset towards district judiciary. "I think we've fostered a culture of subordination...I make a conscious effort not to call our district judges as subordinate judges because they are not subordinates, they belong to the district judiciary," he added.

193.title: ICC names 5 best matches of T20 World Cup 2022
193.article_body: The ICC has named five best matches of the recently-concluded T20 World Cup 2022. It has included three matches involving India. The list features Netherlands' win over South Africa, with ICC calling it "an upset of great magnitude". India's last-ball win over Pakistan, Zimbabwe's win over Pakistan, and England and South Africa's victories against India have been included.

194.title: Cambodian PM Hun Sen tests COVID +ve at G20 after meeting world leaders at ASEAN summit
194.article_body: Cambodian PM Hun Sen has tested COVID-19 positive at the G20 summit in Indonesia, days after meeting world leaders including US President Joe Biden and India's Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar at ASEAN summit. He cancelled all his G20 meetings and is returning to Cambodia. He said it was "lucky" he arrived late in Bali and missed a dinner with other leaders.

195.title: Which countries have highest number of int'l students in US as India comes 2nd?
195.article_body: China and India represent the majority (52%) of all international students in the United States. China remains the top sending country in 2021/22, with 290,086 students. India, the second top-sending country, sent 199,182 international students in 2021/22, an increase of 19% year-over-year. South Korea is third, followed by Canada, Vietnam, Taiwan, Saudi Arabia, Brazil, Mexico and Nigeria.

196.title: Google to pay $391.5 million in US location-tracking settlement
196.article_body: Alphabet's Google has agreed to a $391.5-million settlement with 40 US states over its location-tracking practices and misleading consumers since at least 2014. The state attorneys opened an investigation in 2018 after a report of Google recording location data even when users instruct it not to. This was in violation of state consumer protection laws.

197.title: T'gana govt auctions open plots, flats in Hyd, other districts
197.article_body: The Telangana government is conducting auctions of open plots and flats in Hyderabad and other districts to raise ₹2,000 crore. Over 450 open plots under Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) limits and 2,400 plots in other seven districts of the state will be available for the auction which started on November 14 and will continue till November 23.

198.title: Hope the monster gets harshest punishment: Swara on Shraddha murder case
198.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said that the Shraddha murder case is "horrifying, gruesome and tragic". "Hope police speedily conclude their investigation and hope this monster gets the harshest punishment he thoroughly deserves," she tweeted about Aftab Poonawala, who is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walker. She added that her heart goes out to the victim.

199.title: Parents struggled to pay rents, couldn't even buy me toy: Rashmika
199.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna recalled that there was a time when her parents struggled to pay their house rent. The actress said that in her heart, she is still "that girl who could not even buy a toy". Stating that she respects the money she has earned, Rashmika added, "My childhood memories don't let me take my success lightly."

200.title: King Charles urges UK Parliament to allow his siblings to act in his place
200.article_body: King Charles has asked the British Parliament to amend the law to allow his siblings, Princess Anne and Prince Edward, to act on his behalf in his absence. In a statement read out in the House of Lords on his behalf, King Charles asked for the number of Counsellors of State to be increased to include his siblings.

201.title: Gurugram DC writes to Centre on compensation for NBCC Green View residents
201.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner (DC) Nishant Kumar Yadav has written to the central government demanding its intervention to get NBCC to announce a suitable compensation for residents of NBCC Green View condominium located in Sector 37-D. The condominium was deemed unfit for living during a structural audit, after which Yadav had directed the residents to vacate the flats by March 1.

202.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Birsa Munda, calls him 'great son of India'
202.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Birsa Munda on his birth anniversary and recalled his contribution in giving a sharp edge to the freedom movement. Calling him a "great son of the country", the PM said, "He was not only the hero of our political independence, but he was also the conductor of our spiritual and cultural energy."

203.title: Family of footballer Priya R protests as she dies in botched knee surgery
203.article_body: Family members of an 18-year-old footballer, Priya R, who allegedly died after knee surgery due to medical negligence, held a protest on Tuesday, demanding immediate action from police in the matter. The protest was held as Priya's body was being carried out from the mortuary after a post-mortem. She underwent surgery for a ligament tear.

204.title: Fusion Micro Finance's shares list at 2.3% discount at ₹359
204.article_body: Non-banking finance company (NBFC) Fusion Micro Finance Limited made its stock market debut at a 2.3% discount against its issue price of ₹368/piece on Tuesday. The stock's listing price on the NSE was ₹359.50. The issue, which hit the market during November 2-4, was subscribed 2.95 times. At 11:05 am, the stock was trading at ₹343 per share on BSE.

205.title: 2 men consuming liquor in car assault sales executive in Noida
205.article_body: A sales executive was allegedly assaulted by two men who were consuming liquor in a car in a Greater Noida housing society on Sunday. The victim claimed they parked their car in the middle of the road and he asked them to move. "As I went past them, they got irked and picked up an argument with me," he added.

206.title: Told Shraddha's father her phone was switched off since June: Friend
206.article_body: Lakshman Nadar, a friend of Shraddha Walkar, informed her father that her phone was switched off since June, after which her father filed a missing complaint with police. Nadar last spoke to her in May. "I got worried when Shraddha didn't respond to my messages or returned my calls when I tried to reach her in July and...August," he said.

207.title: India reports 474 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since April 2020
207.article_body: India reported 474 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since April 2020. The number of active cases went down to 7,918 from the earlier 9,468, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,533, according to the ministry.

208.title: Govt releases pic of PM Modi meeting Rishi Sunak for 1st time after he became UK PM
208.article_body: The Prime Minister's Office has released a picture of PM Narendra Modi meeting Rishi Sunak for the first time after the latter became the UK's Prime Minister. "Prime Ministers [Narendra Modi] and [Rishi Sunak] in conversation during the first day of the [G20] Summit in Bali," the PMO wrote on Twitter. PM Modi also met US President Joe Biden.

209.title: BJP is breaking nation, we are unifying it: Mallikarjun Kharge
209.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised the BJP and said that the ruling party is breaking the nation, whereas the Congress is unifying it. "Let us ask you what you have done for the nation and tell us what we haven’t done...There are 30 lakh vacancies in this country and you are giving appointment orders to only 75,000 people," said Kharge.

210.title: Woman, 3 others try to cut off man's private parts in Pune; booked
210.article_body: A woman and her three accomplices were booked after they allegedly tried to cut off a man's private parts in Pune, police officials said. One of the woman's accomplices used her number to message the man to meet her near a temple and when he reached the spot, he was kidnapped, according to the man's complaint. The woman was arrested.

211.title: Man jumps in front of train with 2-yr-old son, both die in Gurugram
211.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped in front of a train along with his two-year-old son near a railway crossing in Gurugram, railway police said on Monday. The man's son also died in the incident. An inquiry revealed that the man had done so after he discovered that his wife had eloped with another man, police said.

212.title: US-based genomics company Illumina to fire at least 500 employees
212.article_body: US-based genomics company Illumina, which makes machines to sequence DNA, has announced that it will fire at least 500 employees, 5% of its workforce, due to current macroeconomic environment. The firm said it is "proactively realigning core Illumina operating expenses to reflect the current macroeconomic environment." Earlier this month, Illumina reported $1.11 billion in core revenues for Q3.

213.title: Aftab used mini saw to chop live-in partner Shraddha's body parts: Report
213.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who has been arrested for the killing of his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi, reportedly used a mini saw to chop off her body parts, reported ANI citing police sources on Tuesday. The news agency reported that only one weapon was used to chop Shraddha's body parts and the mini saw is yet to be recovered.

214.title: 8 Hyd college students arrested over youth's assault after video goes viral
214.article_body: Eight students of a Hyderabad-based institute have been arrested for allegedly assaulting an undergraduate student inside a hostel room, a video of which had surfaced earlier. While five were arrested earlier, three were arrested on Monday, police said. Police added that nine members of the school's administration have also been booked for their alleged inaction in responding to the incident.

215.title: Don't underestimate chocolates, diamonds not needed: Ranveer on anniversary
215.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that one should not underestimate the power of flowers and chocolates. While putting up a story on his wedding anniversary with wife-actress Deepika Padukone, he wrote, "Diamonds not needed...take notes and thank me later gentlemen." He revealed that he surprised Deepika during work at her office on their anniversary.

216.title: Cockroach found in AIIMS' meal for 4-yr-old boy who had stomach surgery; pic surfaces
216.article_body: The AIIMS Delhi administration reportedly initiated an inquiry into a complaint that a cockroach was found in the food served to a four-year-old patient admitted there. A Twitter user posted details about the incident with a picture of the insect, stating that the hospital served "Cockroach Daal" to the boy as first meal post major stomach surgery.

217.title: Bird stuck in kite string saved as Gurugram kids spot it hanging upside down
217.article_body: Teams of the fire brigade and National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) rescued a brown-headed barbet after children in the area saw it hanging upside down on a tree in Gurugram. The bird was entangled in a kite string and almost choked to death, reports said. The children saw the bird trying to free itself.

218.title: Twitter worker posts pic of locked-out laptop after he's fired by Musk over disagreement
218.article_body: Eric Frohnhoefer, an engineer who was fired from Twitter after engaging in a public disagreement with Elon Musk, shared a photo of his locked-out laptop hours after his dismissal. "Guess it is official now," wrote Eric while sharing the photo. He also alleged that he received no formal communication about his termination and said, "They're all a bunch of cowards."

219.title: Biden walks over to PM Modi, hugs him at G20 Summit in Bali; video viral
219.article_body: At the start of the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali, US President Joe Biden walked over to PM Narendra Modi to greet him. A video, which is being widely circulated online, shows the two leaders hugging before exchanging a few words. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and NSA Ajit Doval were also present with PM Modi.

220.title: US orders Air India to pay $121.5 mn as passenger refunds & $1.4 mn as penalty
220.article_body: The US has ordered Air India and five other airlines to pay over $600 million in refunds. Air India has been ordered to pay $121.5 million as refunds and $1.4 million as penalty for delays in providing refunds to passengers due to changes or cancellations in flights. Frontier, TAP Air Portugal, Aeromexico, EI AI, and Avianca were the other airlines.

221.title: US firm Maven Clinic raises $90 mn in round led by General Catalyst
221.article_body: US-based women and family healthcare startup Maven Clinic has secured $90 million in a Series E funding round led by General Catalyst. The funding round saw participation from CVS Health Ventures, La Famiglia and Intermountain Ventures. After the latest round, the company's total capital reached $300 million and valuation increased to $1.35 billion. Maven Clinic was founded by Kate Ryder.

222.title: Nehru taking Kashmir issue to international forum a 'monumental blunder': Puri
222.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri criticised former PM Jawaharlal Nehru over Kashmir, saying the decision of the country's first PM to take the issue to a multilateral forum was a "monumental blunder". "Why was the issue taken to international or multinational fora? My information has been that then Maharaja Hari Singh was happy to sign instrument of accession," Puri asked.

223.title: Vedanta may sell off ESL Steel Limited, exit steel business: Report
223.article_body: Vedanta is planning to sell off ESL Steel Limited (formerly known as Electrosteel Steels Limited) to deleverage the balance sheet which had a debt of $11.7 billion in March-end and exit the steel business, The Economic Times reported. Vedanta has reportedly approached ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel, Tata Steel, JSW and Jindal Steel and Power Limited for the same.

224.title: First international cruise ship arrives at Mumbai Port after 2-yr gap
224.article_body: The sailing season's first international cruise ship arrived at Mumbai Port on Sunday, after a gap of two-year due to COVID-19 pandemic. A Switzerland-based luxury liner MV Viking Mars reached the Mumbai Port with 834 passengers onboard. Before this sailing season ends in May 2023, around 30 international cruise ships are scheduled to visit Mumbai, officials said.

225.title: Will contest polls from Srinagar: Punjab MP on being 'denied entry' into J&K
225.article_body: Punjab MP Simranjit Singh Mann, who was "denied entry" into Jammu and Kashmir, has said that he will contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections from Srinagar. Simranjit had moved a court after he was stopped from entering Kathua last month. However, when Simranjit reached Kathua to appear before the court, he wasn't allowed to move out of the hotel.

226.title: Pakistan bans its official Oscar entry 'Joyland' over 'highly objectionable' material
226.article_body: Pakistan's official 2023 Oscars entry 'Joyland', which is based on transgender love story, has been banned by the country's authorities, citing "highly objectionable" and "repugnant" material. The makers of the film are criticising the ban and calling it "absolutely unconstitutional and illegal". The film was the first Pakistani film to be selected as an official entry at Cannes film festival.

227.title: 18-year-old footballer R Priya dies after botched surgery, amputation in Chennai
227.article_body: R Priya, an 18-year-old footballer who was studying physical education at Chennai's Queen Mary's College, died due to multi-organ failure following medical negligence by doctors at Government Peripheral Hospital, Periyar Nagar. She underwent surgery for ligament tear. She was moved to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, where her right leg had to be amputated due to initial botched surgery.

228.title: Must return to ceasefire & diplomacy in Ukraine: PM at G20 summit
228.article_body: While speaking at the G20 summit in Bali, PM Narendra Modi called for diplomacy in Ukraine. "I've repeatedly said that we have to find a way to return to path of ceasefire and diplomacy in Ukraine," he said. It's necessary to show concrete resolve to ensure peace in the world, he added. Ukraine was invaded by Russia earlier this year.

229.title: Aftab messaged Shraddha's friends on Instagram after murder, paid her credit card bills
229.article_body: According to investigators, after Aftab Poonawala killed his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi on May 18 this year, he logged into her Instagram account and messaged her friends to create the impression that she was still alive. He also paid her credit card bills so that the companies don't contact her Mumbai address, the investigators told the Indian Express.

230.title: Aftab killed Shraddha after she saw him messaging someone: Report
230.article_body: During interrogation, Aftab claimed that Shraddha saw him exchanging messages with someone on the phone, which led to the fatal fight. Earlier, police sources said that Aftab's Google search history revealed he had looked up ways to destroy evidence and clean bloodstains. He also bought incense sticks to mask the smell, sources added.

231.title: Been stalking Sanjay Leela Bhansali like a maniac: Janhvi Kapoor
231.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that Sanjay Leela Bhansali is one of her dream directors to work with. "I've been stalking him like a maniac," she admitted. Janhvi added she would also like to work with Karan Johar and Neeraj Ghaywan. Talking about Karan's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', Janhvi said it is going to be "the most fun" film.

232.title: Actor Krishna was critically ill with multiple organ failure: Hospital
232.article_body: A statement from Continental Hospitals, where legendary actor Krishna was admitted, read that he was critically ill with "multiorgan failure and severe hypoxic brain injury". Krishna, father of actor Mahesh Babu, passed away in Hyderabad after suffering from cardiac arrest. The actor, who featured in over 350 films in his career, was honoured with the Padma Bhushan in 2009.

233.title: You fool, people sleep at night: Akshay on media asking why he sleeps early
233.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that media people ask him why he sleeps so early. "You fool, people sleep at night," he said. "I don't understand. Media persons ask me why do you get up early. But morning is for waking up, right?" he added. He also spoke about people commenting on him doing multiple films a year.

234.title: Suspended BJP MLA criticises T'gana govt as bulletproof vehicle breaks down
234.article_body: Suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh allegedly got angry after his bulletproof vehicle broke down on Monday. He reportedly criticised the Telangana government for providing a vehicle which is in poor condition despite the fact that he faces threat from terrorists. He said that the vehicle had broken down four months ago and was sent back to him after repairs.

235.title: FastJobs.io raises funds from BookMyShow Co-founders, others
235.article_body: Jobtech platform FastJobs.io has raised an undisclosed amount in a pre-seed round from angel investors led by Ashish Hemrajani, BookMyShow Founder and CEO, BookMyShow Co-founder Parikshit Dar, Haresh Chawla, the Founding CEO of Network18 and Partner, True North, along with other angel investors. FastJobs.io was co-founded by Yash Dandavate, Ashish Dogra and Neelu Virk in 2022.

236.title: Okhla Bird Sanctuary dry for over 20 days; migration of birds affected
236.article_body: Noida's Okhla Bird Sanctuary (OBS) has remained dry since the past 20 days, to facilitate canal repair work, and the lack of water seems to have impacted the arrival of winter migratory birds, said birders and park officials. The ongoing repair work is carried out every year but this year it was more extensive, the officials added.

237.title: Alameda CEO & Sam Bankman-Fried's rumoured ex-girlfriend under scrutiny after FTX collapse
237.article_body: The CEO of Alameda Research, Caroline Ellison, 28, is under scrutiny after the collapse of cryptocurrency exchange FTX. As per a report, former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried secretly transferred $10 billion of customer funds from FTX to Alameda. The two had reportedly also dated and she was among Bankman-Fried's nine roommates that operated FTX from a penthouse in the Bahamas.

238.title: Tribal leader files nomination as independent, to contest against son in Guj
238.article_body: The founder of the Bharatiya Tribal Party, Chhotubhai Vasava, on Monday filed his nomination as an independent from the Jhagadia Assembly seat in the Bharuch district of Gujarat. Notably, his son Maheshbhai Chhotubhai Vasava is BTP's official candidate. "Chhotu Vasava...said he'll continue to fight for rights of tribals...Nobody can snatch the Jhagadia seat from him," the founder's aide said.

239.title: Confident G20 leaders will convey message of peace from India: PM
239.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said he is confident that when G20 leaders will meet in India next year for the summit, they all will send a strong message of peace to the world. He called India the land of Buddha and Mahatma Gandhi. "Today world has greater expectations from G-20, the relevance of our group has become more significant," he added.

240.title: We want products 'made in India', not 'made in China': Rahul Gandhi
240.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of ignoring farmers' issues and said that the country wants 'made in India' products, not 'made in China'. Rahul Gandhi added, "The government is not providing [farmers] suitable rates for their produce. They have stopped exports…Rates of oil and gas have…sky-rocketed…Cameras, mobiles and clothes are imported from China."

241.title: School buses in Mumbai seek change in school timings due to heavy traffic
241.article_body: School bus operators in Mumbai are in talks with authorities seeking a change in the timings of some schools around Andheri. The closure of the Gokhale Road bridge has led to severe traffic woes in the city and drivers are not being able to manage multiple shifts and match the school timings, president of School Bus Owners' Association (SBOA) said.

242.title: Must celebrate International Year of Millets with enthusiasm next yr: PM at G20
242.article_body: While speaking at the G20 summit in Bali, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that a mutual agreement to keep the supply chain of both manure and food grains stable and assured should be made. "In India...we're...re-popularising nutritious...and...traditional foodgrains like millets...We all must celebrate International Year of Millets with...great enthusiasm next year," he added.

243.title: Refused 'Salaam Venky' for 3 days, it's parents' worst nightmare: Kajol
243.article_body: Actress Kajol shared that she initially refused 'Salaam Venky' for three days as she found it to be "every parent's worst nightmare". "It's a serious topic which scares us...the film is about the celebration of life," she said. Kajol added that after watching 'Phir Milenge', she decided that she wouldn't say no to Revathy if she ever offers a film.

244.title: Osho disciples to stage protest at Charity Commissioner's Mumbai office
244.article_body: Disciples of Osho from various places will stage a silent protest outside the Charity Commissioner's office in Mumbai's Worli today as it's expected to announce the re-bidding of Osho's Pune land. "Around 300 of us will be gathering outside the Charity Commissioner's office…Tuesday, the re-bidding will be opened...the earlier one was held improper on various grounds," said a disciple.

245.title: Pat Cummins pulls out of IPL 2023 due to packed international schedule
245.article_body: Australia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins has pulled out of IPL 2023, citing a "packed" international schedule. Calling it a difficult decision, Cummins, who was signed to KKR, tweeted, "The international schedule is packed with Tests and ODIs for the next 12 months, so will take some rest ahead of an Ashes series and World Cup."

246.title: Aftab brought woman home on date while Shraddha's body parts were hidden in fridge: Report
246.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who was arrested for killing his 27-year-old live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi in May 2022, allegedly brought another woman to his flat on a date while Shraddha's body parts were stuffed in a fridge, The Indian Express reported on Tuesday. "The other woman came to his house a couple of times in June-July," the report read.

247.title: No political pressure on police: Shinde on Awhad's molestation case
247.article_body: After NCP leader Jitendra Awhad was booked on charges of molestation after he allegedly pushed a female BJP leader, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the police will conduct a probe and take necessary actions. "There'll be transparency. There's no political pressure on...police," he added. "Police registered two false cases against me in 72 hours," Awhad had said earlier.

248.title: Comedian Jay Leno's face burned in car fire in Los Angeles
248.article_body: Comedian Jay Leno was taken to a medical centre after his face was burned in his Los Angeles garage when one of his cars caught fire. "I got some serious burns from a gasoline fire...Just need a week or two to get back on my feet," he said. He has been one of America's most-watched late night TV hosts.

249.title: 'I've right to make my decisions' were the last words to parents by Shraddha
249.article_body: As per the FIR filed by her father, while leaving her Mumbai home in 2019, Shraddha Walkar's last words to her parents were, "I'm 25-years-old and I have every right to make my own decisions. I want to be in a live-in relationship with Aftab Poonawala." "You may think I'm not your daughter from today," she reportedly told them.

250.title: Selligion Technologies raises ₹3 crore in seed funding round
250.article_body: Selligion Technologies raised ₹3 crore from Bounce Infinity CEO Vivekananda Hallekere, Jar App CEO Nishchay Ag and Xiaomi Global founding team member Alvin Tse, who participated in a seed round. Selligion has developed Praho, the world's first direct-to-consumer, hybrid cloud-based computer. The firm was founded by Naman Chakraborty, Yoshita Sengupta, Joby John and Puneet Raheja in 2020.

251.title: 5 of family drown after they jump into canal to save woman in Guj
251.article_body: Five members of a family drowned after they all jumped into the Narmada canal in a bid to save a woman in Gujarat's Mundra, Kutch West SP Saurabh Singh said. The SP added that the incident took place when the woman slipped into the canal while fetching water. The bodies of the deceased have been recovered, the SP further said.

252.title: Helping someone raise standard of living isn't 'revadi': Amit Shah
252.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said giving support to raise someone's standard of living or make infrastructure isn't "revadi". "Giving electricity isn't revadi, no bill is. Giving a house isn't revadi but keeping it tax-free is," Shah added. "We gave free ration amid pandemic because of lingering slowdown after COVID-19 affected the poor," he stated.

253.title: One night she asked me to take her out, said Aftab will kill her: Shraddha's friend
253.article_body: A friend of Shraddha Walker, the 26-year-old woman who was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Ameen, has claimed that the couple used to fight a lot. He said that one night Shraddha sent him a WhatsApp message, requesting him to take her somewhere. "She said that if she lived with Aftab that night, he'd kill her," he added.

254.title: Had best excuse to not hit gym after baby, smashed each session: Ranbir's coach
254.article_body: Ranbir's coach Drew Neal said that the actor had the "best excuse" to not hit the gym after the birth of his daughter on November 6. However, Neal said that the actor did not skip a beat and smashed every single session. Neal posted a picture of himself with the actor from the gym on Instagram.

255.title: Some Twitter contract workers learnt they were fired after reading other's tweets
255.article_body: After mass layoffs of its full-time staff, Twitter has reportedly fired 4,400 contractual workers and as per reports, the affected staff were not given any formal notices about the same. "This tweet is how I found out," wrote an affected worker on a journalist's tweet about the job cuts. The journalist also shared a similar text message from another worker.

256.title: Daughters of India deserve justice: Cong's Jairam on Shraddha murder case
256.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh condemned the murder of 26-year-old Shraddha Walkar by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawalla in Delhi, saying she and "the daughters of India deserve justice". "The entire nation is shocked and angry at the brutality with which Aftab Poonawalla killed his live-in partner…No words can describe this trauma. This is a heinous crime," Ramesh added.

257.title: Bengaluru gets new police commissioners for traffic and crime
257.article_body: The Karnataka government did several transfers in the police department and also created a new post in traffic department. MA Saleem, a 1993-batch IPS officer, was appointed as Special Commissioner of Bengaluru Traffic Police. Among other major changes in the city, the government has appointed Deputy Commissioner (Crime) SD Sharanappa as the Joint Commissioner (Crime) in place of Raman Gupta.

258.title: Delhi's air quality improves from 'very poor' to 'poor'; AQI at 221
258.article_body: The air quality in Delhi improved on Tuesday, though it still remained in the 'poor' category. An AQI of 221 was recorded in Delhi while the AQI in Terminal 3 was 218. On Monday, the Delhi High Court commented that it cannot close its eyes to the fact that Delhi's air quality oscillates between 'very poor' and 'severe'.

259.title: Measles outbreaks in Govandi slums since January: Central team
259.article_body: The Centre-appointed three-member team, which was sent to Mumbai to check measles outbreak, found that Govandi slums had continuous waves of the disease since January. The team, which was in Mumbai for three days, found that 60% of the measles cases did not take vaccine and 40% did not take second dose which is given on 16th month since birth.

260.title: ₹2.85 cr pipeline sanctioned after Hyd kid's request on Children's Day
260.article_body: After a young boy from Hyderabad requested Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao for a drinking water pipeline in the city's Golden City Colony, a pipeline at a cost of ₹2.85 crore was sanctioned for the area. This was done after KTR responded to the video and asked Managing Director of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board to resolve issue.

261.title: Unmanned barricades still found in Delhi: HC to Delhi Police
261.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday observed that unmanned barricades are still found in the national capital and directed the Delhi Police to file a detailed report on the number of barricades that have been set up. The court also cited an incident wherein a sitting judge faced problems due to unmanned barricades while taking his mother to the hospital.

262.title: 93.5%* learners placed at top tech companies: Scaler
262.article_body: With the right learning environment and mentorship, learners can secure a spot at their dream tech company, said Scaler. It mentioned that learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there. Scaler's alumni are working at top companies such as Amazon, Microsoft, Delhivery, Udaan, Myntra, and more, it added.

263.title: Actor John Aniston passes away aged 89; daughter Jennifer Aniston shares post
263.article_body: John Aniston, the Emmy-winning star of the show Days of Our Lives and father of Jennifer Aniston, has died at age 89. "Sweet papa... John Anthony Aniston. You were one of the most beautiful humans I ever knew. I am so grateful that you went soaring into the heavens in peace...And on 11/11 no less," Jennifer wrote in her post.

264.title: Man Utd kind of didn't believe something was wrong: Ronaldo on daughter's illness
264.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo, in a recent interview, accused Manchester United hierarchy of "doubting" his words when he told them his newborn daughter was sick after the death of his newborn son. Ronaldo said, "They kind of didn't believe...something was wrong...which made me feel bad." He added, "I didn't go to...pre-season because of that. I wouldn't let my family suffer for...pre-season."

265.title: PM Modi, US President Biden interact during G20 Summit in Bali, PMO shares pic
265.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden were seen interacting in Indonesia's Bali as the G20 Summit kicked off on Tuesday. In a photo shared by the Prime Minister's Office, the two leaders were seen shaking hands and smiling. A video tweeted by ANI showed PM Modi interacting with Biden and greeting French President Emmanuel Macron.

266.title: I failed to see warning signs: FTX ex-CEO Bankman-Fried
266.article_body: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried in an interview with the NYT agreed he expanded his business too quickly and failed to see the warning signs for FTX. "Had I been a bit more concentrated on what I was doing, I would have been able to be more thorough," he added. However, he declined to discuss the prospect of prison time.

267.title: New Zealand announce squads for ODI and T20I series against India, Trent Boult dropped
267.article_body: New Zealand have announced their squads for the upcoming ODI and T20I series against India. Pacer Trent Boult, who gave up his central contract in August, has been dropped from both the squads. Opener Martin Guptill has also not been included. Tom Latham will keep wickets in the ODI series, while Devon Conway will keep wickets in the T20I series.

268.title: Bodies of 8 labourers recovered after Mizoram stone quarry collapse, search on for others
268.article_body: The bodies of eight Bihar labourers were recovered on Tuesday after they were reported trapped when a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram on Monday. Reports said that the search is still on for others. National Disaster Response Force said that the identification of the dead bodies would be done after post-mortem examination.

269.title: Veteran actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna dies after suffering cardiac arrest
269.article_body: Veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna who had suffered a cardiac arrest has passed away in Hyderabad. Doctors said that CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) was performed immediately and he was shifted to the ICU for treatment and observation. He had acted in 350 films and was one of the top actors of the time.

270.title: 21-year-old woman slips & falls into quarry, dies in Pune
270.article_body: A 21-year-old woman died after she slipped and fell into a quarry when she went out of her house to throw garbage in Pune. A father and his son, who're owners of the quarry, have been booked on charges of negligence following the incident, an inspector said. "There have been reports of cattle death after falling into...quarry," the inspector added.

271.title: Shoaib Malik pens birthday post for Sania Mirza amid divorce rumours
271.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik took to Instagram to pen a birthday post for his wife Sania Mirza amid rumours of their divorce. Sharing a picture, Malik wrote, "Happy Birthday to you @mirzasaniar...Wishing you a very healthy & happy life! Enjoy the day to the fullest." The Indian tennis player turned 36 on Tuesday.

272.title: He's fired: Musk to Android engineer who publicly argued with him on Twitter
272.article_body: Elon Musk fired an Android engineer from Twitter after the latter contended his claims of Twitter being "super slow" and argued about it with him on the social media platform. "He's fired," tweeted Musk in the thread involving their communication. Eric Frohnhoefer reportedly received no formal communication about this and was locked out of his computer within five hours.

273.title: Buffett's Berkshire buys $4.1-billion stake in chipmaker TSMC
273.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed a stake worth more than $4.1 billion in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC). Berkshire owns about 60.1 million American depositary shares of the chipmaker. It also disclosed new stakes of $297 million in building materials company Louisiana-Pacific and of $13 million in Jefferies Financial Group.

274.title: SpaceX bought a tiny ad package on Twitter for Starlink: Elon Musk
274.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has revealed that SpaceX Starlink has bought a "tiny" ad package "to test [the] effectiveness of Twitter advertising in Australia and Spain". It did the same for Facebook, Instagram and Google, he added. This comes after reports said that SpaceX had ordered "one of the larger advertising packages available from Twitter".

275.title: Adani Ports forms JV with Gadot Chemical Terminals to buy Israel's Haifa Port
275.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) announced setting up of a joint venture (JV) with Gadot Chemical Terminals in Israel, named Mediterranean International Ports ADGD Ltd. The JV will execute the acquisition of Haifa Port Company, which operates the Haifa Port in Israel. APSEZ holds a 70% stake in the JV, while the remaining will be with Gadot.

276.title: BSF jawan dies after a horse kicks him during championship practice in MP
276.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) jawan died after a horse hit him while he was practicing for an equestrian championship at BSF Academy Tekanpur in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said that during practice, a horse hit the jawan with its leg, causing a fatal head injury. He was pronounced dead after being taken to the hospital.

277.title: Germany nationalises former subsidiary of Russia's Gazprom
277.article_body: Germany has announced the nationalisation of a former subsidiary of Russian state-owned energy giant Gazprom in a bid to ensure energy security amid the war in Ukraine. The new company Securing Energy for Europe GmbH (SEFE), previously called Gazprom Germania, indirectly controls Germany's largest gas storage facility. Berlin had placed the company under its effective control back in April.

278.title: Difficult for MI to release Pollard but need to take tough calls: Harbhajan
278.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh commented on whether IPL franchise Mumbai Indians should retain or release all-rounder Kieron Pollard for the upcoming season. "I think it's going to be very difficult for MI to release Pollard. He has been there for many years. But yes, there are times when you have to take...tough calls," Harbhajan said.

279.title: Maha Speaker denies receiving molestation-accused MLA Awhad's resignation
279.article_body: NCP MLA Jitendra Awhad on Monday said he has tendered his resignation, condemning "false cases" registered against him, and addressed it to Maharashtra Assembly's Speaker. Awhad was booked for outraging the modesty of a female BJP leader. Speaker Rahul Narwekar, however, said Awhad didn't physically submit his resignation letter, which is required as per the rules of the House.

280.title: Farmers defamed, harassed in the name of stubble burning: Tikait
280.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait said farmers are being harassed in the name of stubble burning and commercial use norms of tractor-trolleys. "The government is defaming farmers without realising that we had no other option but to stage the 13-month-long stir," said Tikait. He added that he feared the government would 'imprison' farmers who don't buy seeds from multi-national companies.

281.title: Pet dog helps rescue owner who fainted in forest in Karnataka
281.article_body: A pet dog reportedly helped family members and villagers locate his owner after he got lost deep in a forest in Karnataka's Shivamogga district. When Shekharappa, who went to the forest to collect firewood, didn't return home, a search was launched. His dog joined the search operation hours later and found Shekharappa lying unconscious on the ground in the forest.

282.title: Russia adds 100 Canadians to its no-entry list in retaliatory move
282.article_body: Russia on Monday barred entry to 100 Canadian citizens in response to sanctions against Russians by Canada over the war in Ukraine. The Russian Foreign Ministry said that the Canadians added to its no-entry list included officials, business leaders and people involved with "media and financial structures that are directly involved in the formation of an aggressive anti-Russian course".

283.title: Centre doing nothing to control price rise of essentials: CM Mamata
283.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP-led Centre is doing nothing to check the price rise of essential commodities. "It (Centre) is only interested in using agencies against the Opposition parties. They are...using threats and intimidation tactics," CM Mamata said. She added, "The Centre is taking away all the money through GST but is not giving our (Bengal) dues."

284.title: Stay strong and protect your pride: RSS' Mohan Bhagwat to tribals
284.article_body: RSS leader Mohan Bhagwat, in Chhattisgarh, said tribal pride was India's pride and appealed to people to stand together to protect it for the country. "Some people try to dupe us by taking advantage of our innocence but we have to stay strong," said Bhagwat. Recently, the BJP alleged that religious conversion of tribals is rising in the state.

285.title: 6th seed Rublev beats 2020 champion Medvedev in Red Group in ATP Finals
285.article_body: Sixth seed Andrey Rublev beat 2020 champion Daniil Medvedev 6-7(7-9), 6-3, 7-6(9-7) in his first match of the Red Group in ATP Finals in Turin on Monday. The 25-year-old won the 37-shot rally to claim the victory on his fifth match point in the third-set tie-break. Rublev won his 50th match of the season in two hours and 31 minutes.

286.title: Verstappen refuses to help F1 teammate Perez during Brazilian GP
286.article_body: During the Brazilian Grand Prix, F1 world champion Max Verstappen refused to help teammate Sergio Perez pass him and gain points to finish second in the championship. "Yeah, it shows who he really is," said Perez during the race. Perez had helped Verstappen beat Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton to take his first title during the 2021 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

287.title: Indian smartphone market falls to 3-year low at 43 million in Q3: Report
287.article_body: India's smartphone market saw a slump of 10% year-on-year in the last quarter to 43 million units, marking the lowest third-quarter shipment since 2019, according to a report from International Data Corporation (IDC). The 5G smartphone share reached 36% of total smartphones during the reported quarter with 16 million units. The average selling price for 5G smartphones was about ₹32,000.

288.title: Shaheen Afridi advised 2-week rehab after injuring knee in T20 WC 2022 final
288.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi has been advised two-week rehabilitation after he hurt his knee during the T20 World Cup 2022 final against England. "Discomfort was likely due to a forced knee flexion whilst landing," said PCB. Shaheen was forced to leave the field after he hurt his right knee while taking a catch in 13th over of England's innings.

289.title: PCB wasted 40 days of Shaheen's rehab by keeping him with Pak team: Sarfraz
289.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Sarfraz Nawaz criticised PCB for including pacer Shaheen Afridi in the T20 World Cup squad. "You have put Shaheen directly in WC without him playing any match since July...He shouldn't have been selected without proving it," Sarfraz said. "The PCB wasted 40 days of rehab by making a decision of keeping Shaheen with the national team," Sarfraz alleged.

290.title: 2nd India-Canada Consular Dialogue held in New Delhi
290.article_body: Indian and Canadian delegations met in New Delhi on Monday for the 2nd India-Canada Consular Dialogue which focused on improving consular, visa, and mutual legal assistance cooperation. India raised several matters, including issues related to fraudulent immigration and fake job offers, the Ministry of External Affairs informed. India also took up issues being faced by Indian students in Canada.

291.title: Kerala schools to sensitise kids about body shaming: State minister
291.article_body: Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty called body shaming "a heinous act" and said the state government will sensitise students by including awareness programmes and lessons against it in school curriculum. In a Facebook post, he said, "There are many of us who have lost sanity being victims of body shaming." He added that a healthy discussion is needed regarding this.

292.title: Release Venkatesh, get him back at lesser price in IPL 2023 auction: Harbhajan
292.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said KKR shouldn't do an overall release of all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer in IPL 2023 auction. "You should release...and get him back at a lesser price if possible because the player is destructive. We saw a short trailer in...seven or eight matches he played," he added. Iyer was retained by KKR ahead of IPL 2022 auction for ₹8 crore.

293.title: Feared Russell wouldn't finish the Brazilian GP he won: Mercedes F1
293.article_body: Mercedes F1 said they feared driver George Russell would not finish the Brazilian Grand Prix, which he eventually won, due to a water leak. "We all agreed we're going to let him drive to the end even without water, on whatever was there to cool it," said team boss Toto Wolff. The win was Russell's maiden victory in the sport.

294.title: Some do part-time politics & full-time hypocrisy: Naqvi on Owaisi
294.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi accused AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi of "communal politics" and 'creating a divide in society'. "Some people just wear a secular sherwani (attire) and carry out communal karastani (conspiracy). They do part-time politics and full-time pakhand (hypocrisy)," said Naqvi. He added that PM Narendra Modi has never discriminated against Muslims during his tenure.

295.title: Assam working on land rights for indigenous people: CM Sarma
295.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state is working on providing land rights to indigenous people through self-certification. He added that the self-certification will state that the claimant has been residing on the land for at least three generations without any dispute. Sarma urged the targeted beneficiaries to benefit from 'Mission Basundhara 2.0', launched for this purpose.

296.title: The next 12 months could be my last in Test cricket: David Warner
296.article_body: Australia's 36-year-old opener David Warner has said that the next 12 months could be his last in Test cricket. "I love the white-ball game...it's amazing," he stated, indicating that he'd retire from the longest format of the game first. "I will be looking to get to 2024," Warner stated, suggesting he'd like to feature in T20 World Cup 2024.

297.title: It wasn't my day today but still in competition: Nadal on loss in ATP Finals
297.article_body: Rafael Nadal took to Instagram Stories following a 6-7(3-7), 1-6 loss in his first match of Green Group in ATP Finals. "It wasn't my day today but still in competition. See you Tuesday. Once again thanks for the support Torino," he wrote. Top-seeded Nadal will face Canada's Felix Auger-Aliassime, who was beaten by Norwegian Casper Ruud, in his second match.

298.title: Tiger Global Management offloads PB Fintech shares worth ₹522.50 crore
298.article_body: Tiger Global Management has offloaded shares amounting to a 2.98 per cent stake in Policybazaar's parent firm PB Fintech for ₹522.50 crore through open market transactions. According to data from the NSE, funds managed by Tiger Global have sold a total of 1,34,17,607 shares. The shares were disposed of at an average price of ₹389.38-₹389.44 apiece.

299.title: Gujarat HC likely to hear suo motu PIL on Morbi tragedy tomorrow
299.article_body: The Gujarat High Court is likely to hear the suo motu PIL on the Morbi bridge tragedy on Tuesday. The matter was not taken up on Monday due to the unavailability of the bench headed by Chief Justice Aravind Kumar. The division bench, on November 7, had issued a notice to the state government and sought a status report.

300.title: Late actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's daughter pens note for him, shares old pics
300.article_body: Late actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's daughter Diza took to Instagram to pen a note following Siddhaanth's demise. Sharing old pictures, she wrote, "It still hasn't sunk in...I still don't know how to react." "You were always my best friend first and heard all my problems, advised me in boy issues...threatened to kill half the male population," she wrote.

301.title: As a kid, I had a hole in my heart: TV actress Niti Taylor
301.article_body: TV actress Niti Taylor has revealed that as a kid, she had a hole in her heart. She added, "There were many things...I wasn't allowed to do including dance because it could jeopardise my health. I couldn't go to amusement parks or take flights or do anything remotely adventurous." "When I recovered, I danced with joy," said Niti.

302.title: I'll work & sleep in Twitter's headquarters until the company is fixed: Musk
302.article_body: The world's richest man and Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday tweeted that he had been at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters "all night". He added, "Will be working & sleeping here until org (organisation) is fixed," he added. Earlier, Musk complained that Twitter's Android app is too slow.

303.title: Over 1,000 cheated in pan-India online Ola scooty scam, 16 arrested
303.article_body: Delhi Police's Cyber Crime Unit on Monday busted an online pan-India Ola electric scooty scam in which over 1,000 people have been cheated. At least 16 people have been arrested in the case from various parts of the country, DCP (Outer North) Devesh Mahla said. According to him, 114 SIM cards, over 60 cellphones and seven laptops have been seized.

304.title: Shraddha told us Aftab fights with her & beats her up: Shraddha's father
304.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, the woman who was killed and whose corpse were dismembered by her live-in partner Aftab in Delhi, had told her parents about suffering physical abuse. "My daughter would tell her mother that Aftab quarrels with her and beats her up," said her father Vikas Walkar in the FIR. Shraddha had spoken to him about it too, he said.

305.title: Hindi version of 'Kantara' collects ₹75.95 crore at box office
305.article_body: The Hindi version of the Kannada film 'Kantara' collected ₹75.95 crore at the box office till Sunday. The Hindi version of the film, which was directed and written by Rishab Shetty, had released on October 14. The Hindi version of the film collected ₹1.27 crore on day one. The Kannada film also featured actress Sapthami Gowda and actor Kishore.

306.title: L&T, Mindtree get merger approval, to be India's 5th largest IT firm
306.article_body: L&T Infotech and Mindtree received approval for a merger by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The combined entity will become LTIMindtree and will be India's fifth-largest IT provider by market capitalisation and sixth-largest by revenue. L&T Group Chairman AM Naik said that LTIMindtree along with L&T Technology Services (LTTS), will generate $5.6 billion in revenue this year.

307.title: 'Raksha Bandhan' actress Sadia to star in John's 'The Diplomat': Reports
307.article_body: Actress Sadia Khateeb, who was seen in the film 'Raksha Bandhan', has reportedly bagged a part in 'The Diplomat', an upcoming film which stars John Abraham. 'The Diplomat', which went on floors a few days back in Chandigarh, is being directed by Shivam Nair of 'Special OPS' and 'Naam Shabana' fame, according to reports.

308.title: If something happens to Shaheen, where will you find another like him: Javed
308.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed commented after pacer Shaheen Afridi got injured in the middle of the T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "Shaheen wasn't fit enough to play...He is important but the WC will come again after 2 years. If something happens to Shaheen, how are you going to bring another bowler like him?" Javed asked.

309.title: NCW seeks detailed report from Delhi Police on Shraddha murder case
309.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has asked for a detailed report from Delhi Police on the Shraddha murder case. "Proper investigation should be done and exemplary punishment must be given to avert such incidents in future," the commission said. Shraddha was allegedly killed by her live-in partner Aftab Ameen Poonawalla. Her body was chopped into 35 pieces in Delhi.

310.title: 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' makers planning to release film in 2024: Report
310.article_body: The makers of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' are planning to release the film in early 2024, according to a report. "Sukumar's (director) perfection will lead to a delay in the film's release...He doesn't want to rush to complete...shoot and hence, the makers, for now, have decided to release Pushpa 2...in March-April 2024," a source was quoted as saying.

311.title: Aamir to not act in 'Champions', says 'Will approach other actors'
311.article_body: Aamir Khan, who was set to star in the upcoming film 'Champions', revealed that he will now produce the film. He has decided to take a break from acting in order to spend more time with his family. "I'll be approaching other actors now to do the role...I was hoping to do...Hopefully, that will go well," Aamir said about 'Champions'.

312.title: CIA chief to warn Russian counterpart against nuke use: Report
312.article_body: CIA Director William Burns on Monday will caution the head of Russian external intelligence agency SVR about the "consequences of the use of nuclear weapons by Russia", a White House spokesperson said, AP reported. Burns won't hold negotiations over the Ukraine war, the spokesperson added, speaking on condition of anonymity. The spokesperson said the meeting would take place in Ankara.

313.title: Centre ready to bring fuel under GST but states won't agree: Puri
313.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said the Centre is ready to bring petrol and diesel under the GST but the state governments are unlikely to agree. "They (states) get revenue out of this. One who is getting revenue, why would he leave it?" said Puri. He added that India insulated itself from the rising fuel prices by reducing excise duty.

314.title: This kid is special: Yuvraj on 18-yr-old Garnacho's late-winner vs Fulham
314.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to praise Alejandro Garnacho after the 18-year-old scored his first goal in Premier League to hand Manchester United a last-minute win over Fulham on Sunday. "Unittedddd!!!!! What a win...Garnacho, this kid is special!!! Man of the Match," he wrote. Manchester United won 2-1. It was Garnacho's first goal in three Premier League appearances this season.

315.title: Hyderabad man who murdered wife over dowry in 2014 jailed for life
315.article_body: A Hyderabad man was sentenced to life imprisonment by a local court for murdering his wife over dowry in 2014. The accused, identified as Pidugu Sudhakar, married the deceased in 2011 and, over time, started harassing her for more dowry and even suspected her fidelity. In a fit of rage, he doused her with kerosene and set her on fire.

316.title: Hardik should be India's captain in T20 World Cup 2024: Srikkanth
316.article_body: Ex-Chairman Kris Srikkanth said if he were the Chairman of BCCI's selection committee then he'd appoint Hardik Pandya as India's captain for T20 World Cup 2024. "And start rebuilding a side right from today, that's from...New Zealand series which is going to happen in a weeks' time," he added. Hardik will lead India in upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

317.title: Sexual intention key aspect to filing case under POCSO: Gujarat HC
317.article_body: The Gujarat HC set aside proceedings initiated under the POCSO Act against a school principal, teacher and others citing lack of "sexual intention". The bench said that the offence should be committed to further the accused's "sexual intention". The victim's mother had alleged that the school principal and teachers threatened to leak a video of the girl adjusting her skirt.

318.title: People of Gujarat shouldn't waste their votes on Congress: Kejriwal
318.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said the people of Gujarat should not "waste their votes" on the Congress as his party was the one in direct contest with the ruling BJP. "They (voters) should vote for the AAP, which is offering hope to your children and your family," said Kejriwal. He further claimed that Congress will only get four-five seats.

319.title: 4 University of Idaho students found dead; homicide probe launched
319.article_body: Police in the US state of Idaho opened a homicide investigation into the death of four University of Idaho students whose bodies were discovered in a house near the university campus. The incident prompted the university to order its students and staff to shelter in place and avoid the area. The alert was lifted about three hours later.

320.title: Amazon plans to lay off nearly 10,000 employees starting this week: Reports
320.article_body: Amazon plans to lay off nearly 10,000 employees beginning this week, The New York Times reported citing people aware of the matter. It would be the largest job cut in Amazon's history, the report said. The layoffs would represent less than 1% of Amazon's global workforce and would focus on the company's devices organisation, retail division and human resources.

321.title: Indian women sing 'Chitthi Aayi Hai' while welcoming PM Modi in Bali, video surfaces
321.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Indonesia's Bali for the 17th G20 Leaders' Summit. In a video that has surfaced online, women from Indian community in Bali can be heard singing 'Chitthi Aayi Hai' song while welcoming PM Modi. PM Modi also shared pictures on Twitter following his arrival in Bali.

322.title: Pandit Nehru’s book to be given out as Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes
322.article_body: The Bharat Jodo Yatra entered its 68th day as it resumed from Kalamnuri in Maharashtra's Hingoli district after a one-day break. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said 600 copies of Jawaharlal Nehru's book 'Discovery of India' will be distributed to celebrate the former PM's birth anniversary. "Nehru continues to inspire and his relevance has only increased after 2014," said Ramesh.

323.title: POCSO not meant to criminalise consensual relations: Delhi HC
323.article_body: The Delhi High Court said the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act was "never meant to criminalise consensual relations between young adults". The court was granting bail to a man arrested under the POCSO Act after marrying a 17-year-old girl. The court observed that a consensual relationship borne out of love should be of consideration while granting bail.

324.title: Musk responds with single-word tweet 'No' to tycoon Legere's offer to run Twitter
324.article_body: John Legere, the former CEO of US telecom major T-Mobile, offered to run Twitter by tweeting, "Hi Elon Musk, maybe I should run Twitter...I'm expensive but so is what you paid for Twitter." Musk responded to Legere's offer with a single-word tweet, "No". Legere later tweeted, "Well that was a short interview...fair enough...Can't say I didn't try."

325.title: 'Adipurush' makers to shave off Saif's beard in film after criticism: Reports
325.article_body: The makers of 'Adipurush' have decided to shave off Saif Ali Khan's beard digitally in the film, according to reports. Following the release of the film's teaser, many on social media compared Saif's look as Raavan to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. The release date of the film has also been postponed from January 12 to June 16.

326.title: Akshay's character in 'Hera...' dropped, Kartik to play new character: Reports
326.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan won't be replacing Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri 3', as per reports. He'll be introduced as a new character in the third instalment as Akshay's character Raju has been dropped, reports said. Akshay recently confirmed his exit from the film, saying he wasn't satisfied with the script. The upcoming film will reportedly be directed by Anees Bazmee.

327.title: After 12 hrs of 'RRR' shoot, Jr NTR rehearsed dance for 2-3 hrs: Rajamouli
327.article_body: 'RRR' filmmaker SS Rajamouli called actor Jr NTR a "fantastic dancer". "Every day, after 12 hours of [RRR's] shoot, Jr NTR used to go back and rehearse for another 2-3 hours each day for the next day's shot, which was recorded in 15 days," he added. The film also featured actor Ram Charan and actress Alia Bhatt.

328.title: He isn't in T20I or ODI team: Sehwag on Shaw ahead of white-ball series vs NZ
328.article_body: Virender Sehwag said he wanted to see batter Prithvi Shaw's name in India's 16-member squad for upcoming white-ball series against New Zealand. "He isn't in...T20I or...ODI team. He hasn't been there in Tests for a long time. I want to see him back," he added. "Shaw plays at 150 strike rate in...top order, he's suitable for T20 cricket," Sehwag stated.

329.title: 11 RSS workers sentenced to life imprisonment in 2013 murder case
329.article_body: A sessions court in Kerala on Monday sentenced 11 RSS workers to life imprisonment for the murder of a man named Anavoor Narayanan Nair. Neyyattinkara Additional Sessions Judge Kavitha Gangadharan, who sentenced the 11 to life term, imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh each on three of the accused. Nair was hacked to death by the RSS workers in 2013.

330.title: No layoffs planned, but will freeze hiring: LinkedIn CEO
330.article_body: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky said that they are not planning layoffs but there will be a hiring freeze across some parts of the company soon. "Like every other leader, we're just continuing to navigate the global strategy that we need to keep the company going to create this platform," said Roslansky. He added that layoffs come with their own problems.

331.title: Adani gets SEBI's nod for open offer for stake in NDTV
331.article_body: The Adani Group has received SEBI's approval to float an open offer for a further 26% stake in NDTV, allowing Adani to buy more equity from the media firm’s minority shareholders. The conglomerate had revised the offer’s roll out date to November 22. It will close on December 5, NDTV said last week.

332.title: Apple search engine faces delay as top talent moves to Google: Report
332.article_body: Apple's search technology is reportedly facing a setback in the development of its search engine as the company has lost its top talent to Google. According to a report by The Information, all those employees were the founders of Laserlike. Apple had acquired the company in 2018 hoping to improve the search functionality of Siri and Spotlight.

333.title: Don't fall for caste, class differences: AAP's Gadhvi to voters
333.article_body: AAP's CM candidate for Gujarat Assembly polls, Isudan Gadhvi urged voters not to fall for caste, class and community differences. "Revolution will come on December 8. I have no political background...It was because these people did not work...that I had to come into politics," Gadhvi said after filing his nomination to contest from Khambhalia.

334.title: German Parliament blocks reform plan for unemployment benefits scheme
334.article_body: Germany's upper house of parliament on Monday blocked a proposed reform to the country's unemployment benefits system, a central policy of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's government. His three-party alliance doesn't have a majority in the upper house. Germany's main centre-right opposition bloc opposes the overhaul, arguing that it would reduce pressure and incentives for people to take available jobs.

335.title: Aditya Birla Capital, Nippon Life merger talks break down: Report
335.article_body: Talks between Aditya Birla Capital and Nippon Life to merge Birla Sun Life and Reliance Nippon Life Insurance Company (RNLIC) have reportedly collapsed as Nippon did not agree to a reduced stake in RNLIC. Nippon Life's stake would have fallen below 10% from 49% following the merger. RNLIC is a subsidiary of Reliance Capital, which is undergoing insolvency resolution process.

336.title: People sorry for boycotting 'Laal...' should've given ₹500 to makers: Manav
336.article_body: Actor Manav Vij has said that Twitter users apologised to him because they boycotted his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in theatres but loved the Aamir Khan-starrer on the OTT platform. "I said, 'If you were so apologetic, you should've transferred ₹500 to Aamir Khan Productions' account. The producers are at a loss because of your stupidity'," he added.

337.title: India lost $7.6 billion due to floods, storms in 2021: WMO report
337.article_body: India may have lost $4.4 billion due to storms and an additional $3.2 billion due to flooding in 2021, the World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) said in a report. China lost $18.4 billion due to flooding, the highest in Asia. Annual investment in adaptation would need to be highest for China ($188.8 billion), followed by India ($46.3 billion), the report added.

338.title: 5 injured in clash between groups over social media post in K'taka
338.article_body: Five persons have been injured in a clash between two groups in Karnataka's Shivamogga district, according to police. As per reports, a dispute between two persons over a comment in response to a social media post turned into a clash between their supporters on Sunday evening. Police added that no communal angle was found behind the clash.

339.title: Man's body found 4 yrs after his wife & her lover killed & buried him in home in UP
339.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested after the skeletal remains of the woman's husband were found in a 6-foot-deep pit in her lover's home in UP's Ghaziabad on Monday, police said. Arun, who had an affair with his neighbour Savita, allegedly killed her husband Chandravir, buried him in the pit and covered it with cement in 2018.

340.title: Will hang Kasab but worship Abdul Kalam: BJP's Guj polls candidate
340.article_body: BJP's candidate from the Muslim-dominated Mandvi seat in Kutch, Aniruddh Dave, on Monday said that he is against Ajmal Kasab and will hang him, but will build temples for the worship of Abdul Kalam. Speaking at an election gathering in the Mandvi Assembly constituency, Dave described himself as a "Brahmin" and said that there's no opposition against any religion.

341.title: MP doubles ex-gratia in cases of deaths by wild animals to ₹8 lakh
341.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has doubled the ex-gratia in cases of people killed in attacks by wild animals from ₹4 lakh to ₹8 lakh. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "In some unfortunate incidents of attacks on human beings by wild animals, some people lose their lives, and it is our endeavour that such incidents don't take place."

342.title: I won't be working as an actor for the next year, year and a half: Aamir Khan
342.article_body: Actor-producer Aamir Khan has said that he won't be working as an actor for the next year, year and a half. "I want to take a break. I want to be with my family," he added. "For the last 35 years, I have single-mindedly been focussed on my work...It's not fair to people who are close to me," Aamir stated.

343.title: Man Utd issue statement after Ronaldo claims that he is being forced out of the club
343.article_body: Manchester United have issued statement after Cristiano Ronaldo claimed in an interview that he is being forced out of the club. "The club will consider its response after...full facts have been established. Our focus remains on preparing for...second half of the season and continuing...momentum, belief & togetherness being built among the players, manager, staff and fans," the statement read.

344.title: List of 25 sportspersons who will be honoured with Arjuna Award 2022 released
344.article_body: The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports today released a list of 25 sportspersons, who'll be honoured with Arjuna Award 2022 on November 30 by President Droupadi Murmu. The winners include two boxers, two badminton players, two chess players, two wrestlers and two shooters, among others. Weightlifter Vikas Thakur and kabaddi player Sakshi Kumari have also been included.

345.title: Aftab read about human anatomy after murdering Shraddha to dispose of body
345.article_body: Aftab Poonawalla, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, read about blood-cleaning methods and human anatomy online after the murder, Delhi Police said. Aftab told police that he read about human anatomy so that it could help him in chopping off the body. Aftab and Shraddha had eloped from Mumbai to Delhi.

346.title: Centre's air quality panel lifts ban on construction activity in Delhi
346.article_body: Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has lifted stage 3 measures under the Graded Response Action Plan as Delhi's air quality index (AQI) improved to 'poor' category. With this, private construction and demolition activities can resume in Delhi. Improvement in AQI is likely to sustain and the situation will be reviewed in a meeting on November 18, CAQM said.

347.title: India cricket will gain nothing by retaining Rohit as captain: Ex-player
347.article_body: Former India pacer Atul Wassan said that Indian cricket will not gain anything by retaining Rohit Sharma as the skipper of the T20 side. "Team management was taking all decisions. Rohit did not take a single call. He only decided where to hide...[Currently,] you have two options in front of you – Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant," Wassan said.

348.title: Taiwan issue is the 'red line' that must not be crossed: China's Xi to US Prez
348.article_body: In his first face-to-face meeting with US President Joe Biden in Indonesia, Chinese President Xi Jinping said that the Taiwan issue is "at the very core of China's core interests". It is also the "first red line that must not be crossed in China-US relations", Xi Jinping said. Biden raised objections over China's "coercive" and "increasingly aggressive" actions towards Taiwan.

349.title: SRK liked 'Drona', wrote a beautiful letter to me after its premiere: Abhishek
349.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said in an interview that Shah Rukh Khan liked his 2008 movie 'Drona'. "Shah Rukh came to...premiere and he wrote me the sweetest letter, that very night, he went home and wrote me a letter about how much he enjoyed [it]," he said, adding, "He said we need to start pushing boundaries; he wrote a beautiful letter."

350.title: Aamir was a father figure on 'Taare...' set, but I was scared of him: Darsheel
350.article_body: 'Taare Zameen Par' actor Darsheel Safary, speaking about working with Aamir Khan, said, "He was...like a father figure on set." He added, "I was also scared of him because I was like if I go slightly out of the way...I'm going to get...a shouting. But I never got shouted at." Darsheel further said he used to play chess with Aamir.

351.title: Guj Cong leader among 345 infected with food poisoning after event
