351.article_body: Over 345 people, including Gujarat Congress leader Suleman Patel, were infected with food poisoning after attending a religious gathering in Bharuch on Sunday. The Congress leader was discharged on Monday, while two children are currently undergoing treatment. People complained of vomiting, diarrhoea and stomach ache after having food at the event.

352.title: Ankush Saigal appointed as Wipro's Telecom Head for Southeast Asia
352.article_body: Wipro has announced Ankush Saigal as its telecom industry sector head in Southeast Asia to lead the company's business growth for the region. Prior to joining Wipro, Saigal worked with Accenture, expanding technology sales across industry, driving go-to-market with key ecosystem partners and managing client relationships. Saigal has also worked with Infosys, managing business relationships.

353.title: Attached clips to hip to recreate gunshot pain for 'Lootera': Ranveer
353.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that he tried to recreate a gunshot-level pain for his 2013 film 'Lootera'. "I used to take these very industrial-grade clips and clip them to my hip in the morning," he stated. "When they said, roll camera, I'd hit it...[the] pain would go from the tip of my toe to my hip," the actor added.

354.title: India have a chance to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Olympic medallist
354.article_body: Ex-Olympic silver medallist Juan Escarre said that India have a chance to win the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar. "Belgium, Australia and you will always find a very good German team...And, the Netherlands and Spain as well. But, you never know, anything is possible in this kind of tournament," Escarre said.

355.title: K'taka BJP leader arrested over threat to Mallikarjun Kharge's son
355.article_body: Karnataka BJP leader Manikanth Rathod was on Sunday arrested for issuing a death threat to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's son and MLA Priyank Kharge. However, he was released on bail later. Rathod had threatened Priyank Kharge after he lashed out at BJP workers over a campaign against him in Chittapur on November 8.

356.title: Congress workers vandalise party office over candidate selection for Guj polls
356.article_body: Congress workers from Jamalpur-Khadia and Vatva in Ahmedabad vandalised the party headquarters to protest against candidate selection for Gujarat Assembly polls. Protestors alleged that MLA Imran Khedawala, Congress' candidate for Jamalpur-Khadia seat, is connected with local real-estate lobby and will lose the polls. A video of the incident showed workers defacing walls and writing slogans.

357.title: 12 labourers feared trapped after stone quarry collapses in Mizoram
357.article_body: At least a dozen labourers from Bihar are feared trapped after a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram on Monday. As per reports, the incident took place when the labourers, who were working in the area, had returned from their lunch break. State Disaster Response Force, Border Security Force (BSF) and Assam Rifles have been deployed to assist in rescue operations.

358.title: Shaheen's injury not a factor, Pak was 15-20 runs short: Gavaskar
358.article_body: Ex-Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that he doesn't think that pacer Shaheen Afridi's injury in the middle of the T20 World Cup final cost Pakistan the match. "Pakistan were around 15-20 runs short...I don't think the 10 deliveries that Shaheen didn't bowl would have made...difference. Maybe Pakistan would have got another wicket, but England would still have won," Gavaskar said.

359.title: Iran strikes Kurdish outfit's HQ in Iraq; 2 killed, 10 injured
359.article_body: Two people were killed and 10 were injured on Monday after an Iranian Kurdish party's headquarters in Iraq's Koye city was hit by rockets and drones, officials said. Iranian state media said the country's Revolutionary Guards had attacked the bases of "terrorist groups" in Iraq's autonomous Kurdish region. Tehran blames Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups for the ongoing unrest in Iran.

360.title: Sharath Kamal Achanta to be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022
360.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal Achanta will be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022. He will receive the award from President Droupadi Murmu on November 30 in a ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan. Sharath Kamal bagged three gold medals at Commonwealth Games in Birmingham earlier this year.

361.title: Narrated 'Salaam Venky' to Aamir Khan, he said 'Won't change a word': Director
361.article_body: Filmmaker Revathy opened up about how actor Aamir Khan agreed to be a part of her upcoming film 'Salaam Venky', which also features Kajol. She stated, "Aamir said he just wanted to read his scenes...It was just over the phone. Then we had a film narration...Aamir said, 'I won't change a single word, I'll just do the film'."

362.title: Musk scolds Android engineer on Twitter, asks 'What have you done to fix the app?'
362.article_body: Elon Musk publicly scolded Twitter app's Android engineer Eric Frohnhoefer and tweeted, "Twitter is super slow on Android. What have you done to fix that?" Musk tweeted this after Eric contended Musk's claim of Twitter being "super slow" in many countries. "I have spent 6 years working on Twitter for Android and can say this is wrong," Eric had said.

363.title: US Prez opposes China's 'aggressive acts' on Taiwan in 1st meet with Chinese Prez
363.article_body: US President Joe Biden met with Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first time since assuming office amid tensions over Taiwan. The meeting took place on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali and Biden raised concerns about China's human rights record, the White House said. He also objected to China's "coercive and increasingly aggressive actions toward Taiwan".

364.title: Pakistan fought valiantly vs England in T20 WC 2022 final: Bangar
364.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan fought "valiantly" in the T20 World Cup 2022 final as having a score of 137 was never going to be enough against the lineup that England possessed. Put to bat first, Pakistan managed to score 137/8 in 20 overs. England chased the target in 19 overs. They won by five wickets.

365.title: Electric mobility startup Yulu raises $9 mn via debt-financing
365.article_body: Electric mobility startup Yulu raised $9 million in funding from US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) through debt-financing. The Bengaluru-based firm was founded in 2017 by RK Misra, Naveen Dachuri, Hemant Gupta and Amit Gupta and provides urban mobility supported by AI-powered battery. In September, Yulu raised $82 million in a funding round led by Canada's Magna International.

366.title: Ex-Army man run over by truck while trying to avoid pothole in K'taka
366.article_body: A retired Indian Army soldier, on a two-wheeler, was killed after he was run over by a truck while trying to avoid a pothole in Karnataka's Mandya district. Police said the truck was seized following the accident and a case was lodged. Former CM and Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised the state government over poor condition of roads.

367.title: Zomato to shut down UAE app on November 24
367.article_body: Zomato announced that it will discontinue its application in the United Arab Emirates on November 24, according to a regulatory filing. Customers looking to order food through the Zomato app in UAE will be redirected to Talabat, the filing added. Zomato sold its UAE food delivery business to Talabat in 2019 for $172 million.

368.title: SEBI proposes mandating top 250 listed firms to confirm or deny media reports
368.article_body: SEBI has proposed mandating the top 250 listed companies to confirm or deny any information reported in the mainstream media, which may have a material effect on the listed entity, to streamline the disclosure requirements. SEBI has also suggested reducing the timeline to 12 hours from the occurrence of events or information for making disclosure to the stock exchanges.

369.title: Wife, brother arrested for murdering 35-year-old man in Ghaziabad
369.article_body: A day after a 35-year-old man was found murdered at his house in Ghaziabad's Loni, the local police arrested his wife and the victim's younger brother for the alleged murder. The accused, Sazra Khatoon (32) and Mohammad Amir (21), allegedly murdered the victim, Ayaz Ahmad, as they were in a relationship which was objected by the victim, police said.

370.title: 35-yr-old man, 5 dogs electrocuted to death near farm in Tamil Nadu
370.article_body: A 35-year-old man and five of his dogs were electrocuted to death when they came in contact with an illegal electric fence near a farm in Tamil Nadu's Madurai district. According to police, the deceased and two of his friends had gone hunting for hares on Saturday night when the incident took place.

371.title: Zomato Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo resigns
371.article_body: Zomato's Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo has resigned from the company after five years, according to a regulatory filing. He joined Zomato in 2017 as the head of product development and assumed the title of Head of New Businesses in August this year. Zomato reported a consolidated net loss of ₹250.8 crore in the quarter ended September.

372.title: Delhi restaurants allowed to serve food in open spaces, terraces
372.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has eased licencing norms for restaurants to use open spaces and terraces for serving food. According to an official document, eateries following certain restrictions will not require an additional fire no-objection certificate (NOC) for using such spaces. No cooking or preparation of eatables is allowed in any part of the open space or terrace.

373.title: Drunk driver rams car onto footpath in Pune, 3 people injured
373.article_body: A real estate dealer who was driving under the influence of alcohol rammed his car onto a footpath in Pune's Wakad area. The driver of the car, Harsh Mohan Singh, hit three people who were walking back home. One of the injured was dragged for a certain distance by the car and sustained head injuries. The police have booked Singh.

374.title: Relationship with SRK, Anil Kapoor has not changed: Subhash Ghai
374.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai has said that his relationship with Shah Rukh Khan and Anil Kapoor has not changed. He further added that Jackie Shroff, Sanjay Dutt, Madhuri Dixit and Mahima Chaudhry are still his friends and they still meet. "I went to Anil's house the day before yesterday. We drank and shared our experience," Subhash further stated.

375.title: 62 migrants rescued from sailboat in Aegean Sea: Greek Coast Guard
375.article_body: A cargo ship rescued 62 migrants from a sailboat taking on water in the eastern Aegean Sea, the Greek Coast Guard said. The survivors were later transferred to a coast guard lifeboat. The coast guard said it had launched a search and rescue operation following a distress call in the early hours of Monday about a vessel in rough seas.

376.title: If you want to become heroes, lift 2023 WC title at Wankhede: Akhtar to Pak
376.article_body: Motivating Pakistan after their five-wicket loss in T20 World Cup 2022 final, Shoaib Akhtar said, "If you want to become heroes, lift the World Cup [2023] trophy at Wankhede Stadium. This is a challenge for you. Go and get fit." Akhtar praised Pakistan, saying, "Well done Pakistan...Playing the World Cup final is not a small achievement."

377.title: SC refuses to stay proceedings in Delhi riots case against Tahir Hussain
377.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to stay proceedings against former AAP Councillor Tahir Hussain over cases registered against him for the 2020 northeast Delhi riots. The bench said it is not inclined to interfere with the Delhi High Court's September 16 interim order and all remedies are open to the petitioner. Hussain has been in judicial custody since March 16, 2020.

378.title: Mumbai gym trainer molests woman, threatens to kidnap her daughter
378.article_body: A 29-year-old gym trainer was arrested for molesting a woman and threatening to kidnap her daughter if she refused to meet him, reports said. The victim said that the accused took her number to place orders for vada pav, on which he called multiple times. Denying such claims, the accused's lawyer said that the two shared pictures on social media.

379.title: Mumbai student aims to make city police stations more eco-friendly
379.article_body: Joint Commissioner (Law and Order) of Mumbai Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil, recently interacted with a young student who had put together a presentation on how to make police stations more environment-friendly. The student's plan included the introduction of air-purifying local plants and making stations plastic-free. His plans included having a more sophisticated water and waste management system.

380.title: Hyd boy asks KTR for municipal water on Children's Day, he responds
380.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a boy from Hyderabad asked Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) for municipal water on Children's Day. KTR responded to the video and asked Dana Kishore, Managing Director, Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), to visit the place and resolve the issue. "Yes sir. Will inspect," Kishore responded.

381.title: Actor Sunil Shende passes away at 75
381.article_body: Actor Sunil Shende, who appeared in shows and movies like 'Circus', 'Shanti' and 'Sarfarosh', passed away at 75 at his Mumbai residence on Monday. The cause of death of Shende, who appeared in movies such as 'Gandhi', 'Ghayaal', 'Ziddi', 'Daud', and 'Viruddh', was not immediately known. "Great actor and a great human being," his 'Shanti' co-star Rajesh Tailang tweeted.

382.title: New portrait of King Charles released to celebrate his first birthday as monarch
382.article_body: A portrait has been released to mark the birthday of King Charles, who turned 74 today. The image shows him leaning against an ancient oak tree in Windsor. Buckingham Palace announced he's taking on role of The Ranger of Windsor Great Park, a post previously held by his father, Prince Philip. This is King Charles' first birthday since becoming monarch.

383.title: Neither of us has felt it: Arbaaz on 22-yr age gap with girlfriend Giorgia
383.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan in an interview addressed the 22-year age gap between him and his girlfriend-model Giorgia Andriani. "There's a humongous age difference between us, but neither of us has felt it," he said. Arbaaz further said that Giorgia is a wonderful girl, adding, "She has that...exuberance in her, that energy in her...I draw energy from her sometimes."

384.title: IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi appointed new CEO of Prasar Bharati
384.article_body: Senior IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi has been appointed the CEO of state broadcaster Prasar Bharati. He will serve in the office for a period of five years, the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said in a statement on Monday. He is currently posted as Chief Executive Officer, MyGov, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

385.title: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Griswold accused of raping teammate
385.article_body: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Robert Griswold, 25, has been accused of raping and abusing his 19-year-old teammate Parker Egbert. As per a lawsuit, Griswold allegedly "maliciously targeted" Parker during Tokyo Paralympics last year and at the US Olympic & Paralympic Training Center in Colorado. "This case is a horrific tragedy," the lawsuit further stated.

386.title: I'll donate majority of my $124 bn wealth: World's 4th richest man Jeff Bezos
386.article_body: Amazon Founder and the world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos has said that he will donate the majority of his $124 billion wealth in his lifetime. "The hard part is figuring out how to do it in a levered way," Bezos said. "It's not easy...There are a bunch of ways that I think you could do ineffective things, too," he added.

387.title: Major highways closed, villages cut off after snowfall, rain in J&K
387.article_body: Major highways were closed and villages in high-altitude areas were cut off due to heavy overnight snowfall and rains in Jammu and Kashmir. As a precautionary measure, authorities closed schools in some districts on Monday. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the valley can reach up to minus 3 degree Celsius on Monday.

388.title: DCW chief issues notice to Delhi Police over Shraddha murder case
388.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to the Delhi Police and taken "suo-moto cognizance" of the murder of a woman, Shraddha, in Mehrauli. The notice directs police to provide various information and documents, including a copy of the FIR registered in the case and details of the action taken report in the matter.

389.title: Delhi bus driver suffers epileptic fit, rams bus into auto; 1 killed
389.article_body: A 49-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed after a bus rammed into his vehicle in Delhi's Civil Lines. The incident took place on Sunday morning when a 37-year-old bus driver suffered an epileptic fit and lost control of the vehicle. The accused has been arrested and booked for rash driving and causing death by negligence.

390.title: I'm sorry: CM Mamata after Bengal minister says 'how does our President look?'
390.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal minister Akhil Giri's remarks on President Droupadi Murmu, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I am sorry, I do apologise on behalf of the party (Trinamool Congress)." Giri courted controversy by saying, "We don't judge anyone by their appearance...but how does our President look?" Mamata condemned his remark, saying, "Beauty can't be decided by external looks."

391.title: It's a myth when people say eat for two during pregnancy: Sonam
391.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, who welcomed a baby boy on August 20, opened up about her diet which she followed during her pregnancy days. She stated that "it's a myth when people say eat for two". "Please be sensible while eating if you are carrying a single baby. You need only 350 calories more," Sonam added.

392.title: Jawaharlal Nehru didn't act in 'desh hith' on Kashmir issue: Rijiju
392.article_body: India's first PM, Jawaharlal Nehru, didn't act in "desh hith" (country's interests) when it came to Kashmir, said Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju. "There was no question of plebiscite or taking views of people or any other organisations. Why did Nehru ji make a departure for Kashmir?" he asked, adding that Hari Singh's views were not accepted.

393.title: Mumbai's air quality drops to 'poor' category, AQI rises to 221
393.article_body: Mumbai's air quality slipped from 'moderate' to 'poor' quality on Monday, with the AQI rising to 221, as per the data released by the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR). The overall AQI was 152 (moderate) on Saturday and it was 159 (moderate) on Sunday. Areas, including Andheri and Malad, too reported 'poor' AQI.

394.title: We need intimacy coordinators, people do get exploited: Radhika Apte
394.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has said that she never had an intimacy coordinator, however, added that they "absolutely need it". "People do get exploited...people who exploit, don't necessarily do it with the intention either," she stated. Radhika recalled an instance when she agreed to do something after coming under pressure, however, her agents said, "This is not okay."

395.title: 'Brahmastra 2' will be juicier & more clash oriented: Ayan Mukerji
395.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has said that 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev' will be "a lot more dramatic and juicier and a lot more clash oriented" than the first film. "I think that part two will just be more of everything, you know, more scale, more VFX, more Astras, more drama modules," Ayan added. 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' featured Ranbir Kapoor.

396.title: Crypto.com sends Ethereum worth $400 mn to another exchange by accident
396.article_body: Crypto.com CEO Kris Marszalek said that the company mistakenly sent over $400 million in Ethereum to another crypto exchange called Gate.io. He said, "It was supposed to be a move to a new cold storage address, but was sent to a whitelisted external exchange address. We worked with Gate team and the funds were subsequently returned to our cold storage."

397.title: Forced religious conversion a serious issue, may affect national security: SC
397.article_body: Forced religious conversion is a "very serious issue" and a "very difficult situation" will emerge if such conversions are not stopped, the Supreme Court observed on Monday. Religious conversions may ultimately affect the security of the nation and the freedom of religion and conscience of citizens, it added. It asked the Centre to make its stand clear on the issue.

398.title: Zelenskyy visits Kherson following the city's recapture from Russia
398.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday visited the southern city of Kherson following its recapture from Russian forces last week. Ukrainians, with their national flags, gathered in front of the administration building in the city's main square where Zelenskyy addressed his troops. He also thanked NATO and other allies for aiding Ukraine in ramping up its war efforts against Russia.

399.title: India need separate teams for different formats of cricket: Kumble
399.article_body: Former Indian skipper Anil Kumble said that India need separate teams for different formats of cricket. "You need, certainly, T20 specialists. I think what this English team...and...Australia have shown is that you need to invest in a lot of allrounders," Kumble said. He added, "No other team [apart from England] has a No. 7 of the quality of Liam Livingstone."

400.title: India's retail inflation declines to a 3-month low of 6.77% in October
400.article_body: India's retail inflation rate fell to a three-month low of 6.77% in October from 7.41% in September, data released by the government showed on Monday. Inflation in rural areas in October 2022 cooled to 6.98%, while that in urban areas softened to 6.50%. Meanwhile, wholesale inflation dipped to 8.39% in October, the lowest since March 2021.

401.title: EU agrees on introducing new sanctions over Iran's protest crackdown
401.article_body: All 27 foreign ministers of EU member states on Monday agreed on the introduction of a new sanctions regime against Iran for its allegedly violent clampdown on the ongoing anti-government protests in the country. The sanctions will target 32 individuals and organisations, including the "inner circle" of the Revolutionary Guard, responsible for the crackdown that has reportedly left hundreds dead.
